insuefactus: <entryFree id="n24030" type="hapax" key="insu^e_factus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insŭēfactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. in-sueofacio</etym>, <sense id="n24030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">accustomed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">habituated</hi> (= assuetus): <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 24, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insuesco: <entryFree id="n24031" type="main" key="insuesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-suesco</orth>, <itype>suēvi, suētum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n24031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> (insuerat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 57</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">to accustom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">habituate</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n24031.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to accustom</hi> or <hi rend="ital">habituate one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become accustomed to</hi> a thing; constr. with <case>dat.</case>, with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24031.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 29</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24031.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad disciplinam militiae insuescere militem nostrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24031.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">largiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amare, potare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 11, 6</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24031.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to accuslom</hi> or <hi rend="ital">habituate</hi> one <hi rend="ital">to</hi> a thing; constr. <hi rend="ital">aliquem aliquid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aliqua re.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24031.6" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquem aliquid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insuevit pater optimus hoc me Ut fugerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 105</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24031.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquem aliqua re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquā pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic insuesci debent, ut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita se a pueris insuetos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:48:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 48, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insuete: <entryFree id="n24032" type="main" key="insue_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insuētē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 2. insuetus <sense id="n24032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
insuetudo: <entryFree id="n24033" type="main" key="insue_tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insuētūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. insuetus</etym>, <sense id="n24033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a being unaccustomed to</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sev. 16, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insuetus: <entryFree id="n24034" type="main" key="insue_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insuētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from insuesco.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24035" type="main" key="insue_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-suētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unaccustomed</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n24035.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24035.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Not accustomed to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unused to</hi> a thing; constr. with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <case>dat.</case>, <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24035.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insuetus contumeliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 30, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus generis pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:44:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 44, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigandi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male audiendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion. 7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moris ejus insueta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 34, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes">3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 115</bibl></cit> Dietsch.— </sense><sense id="n24035.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Inexperienced in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unacquainted with</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum majorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 4</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24035.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insuetus moribus Romanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 18, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insuetae operi manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:48" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 48</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24035.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eques ad stabilem pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 35, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad tale spectaculum,</quote> <trans><tr>not used to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:20:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 20, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora ad onera portanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:78:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 78, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24035.7" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera audire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 31, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24035.8" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to which one is not accustomed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unusual</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insueta liberae civitati species,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:37:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 37, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec, quibus insolita atque insueta sunt, Graeci timeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 17, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limen Olympi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insuetos foetus animalia edere,</quote> <trans><tr>monsters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:21:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 21, 16</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">in-suēta</orth>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, as <pos>adv.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">insueta rudentem (i. e. insolito more),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 248</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">insuētē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">contrary to custom</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">immorari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:3:54" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 3, 54</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insuetius perscrutari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insufficiens: <entryFree id="n24036" type="main" key="insuffi^ci^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insuffĭcĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-sufficio</etym>, <sense id="n24036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">insufficient</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Hermog. 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insufficientia: <entryFree id="n24037" type="main" key="insuffi^ci^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insuffĭcĭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>insufficiens</etym>, <sense id="n24037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">insufficiency</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Uxor. 1, 4</bibl>; Boëth. Cons. Phil. 3, pros. 3.</sense></entryFree>
insufflatio: <entryFree id="n24038" type="main" key="insuffla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insufflātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>insufflo</etym>, <sense id="n24038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blowing into</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aceti naribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:136" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 136</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insufflo: <entryFree id="n24039" type="main" key="insufflo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sufflo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to blow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">breathe into</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">insufflavit in faciem ejus flatum vitae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 5</bibl></cit>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">peri\ stef.</foreign> 10, 9, 19: <cit><quote lang="la">per fistulam os plenum vino,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei spiritum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 15, 11</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 20, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insula: <entryFree id="n24040" type="main" key="insu^la1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>in-sul; cf. con-sul, prop. in-land</etym>. <sense id="n24040.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An island</hi>, <hi rend="ital">isle</hi>, whether formed by the sea, a lake, or a river: <cit><quote lang="la">insulam Britanniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:64:section=144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 64, § 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 159</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 211</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in lacu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 27, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rheni amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:292" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 292</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in medio flumine nata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:72 al" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 72 al.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n24040.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud fustitudinas ferricrepinas insulas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the mills in which</tr>, <tr>as a punishment</tr>, <tr>slaves were forced to grind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 18</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24040.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A house for poor people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which was let out in portions to several<cb n="INSU" />  families;</hi> opp. domus, which was the mansion of a rich family, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:16:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 16, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellego Clodii insulam esse venalem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 7, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:37:4 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 37, 4 al.</bibl>; sometimes also of a <hi rend="ital">single lodging</hi> in such a house, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 38</bibl>; cf. Preller, Regionen der Stadt Rom, p. 86 sq.; Becker, Gallus, 2, p. 146 sq. 2d edit.—</sense><sense id="n24040.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A temple</hi> (eccl.); cf. Is. Voss. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:2:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 32, 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24041" type="main" key="Insu^la2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Insŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n24041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. prop.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a part of Syracuse cut off from the rest by a narrow arm of the sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which was bridged</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 21, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:52:section=117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 52, § 117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insulanus: <entryFree id="n24042" type="main" key="insu^la_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insŭlānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>insula</etym>, <sense id="n24042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an island</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces,</quote> <trans><tr>offered by islanders</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pacat.</author> Pan. Theod. 23, 3</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">insŭlānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an islander</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:18:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 18, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insularis: <entryFree id="n24043" type="main" key="insu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n24043.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an island</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insular</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">insulari poena multavit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>punished him with banishment to an island</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solitudo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">24, 2, 9 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n24043.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sŭlāres</orth>, <gen>m.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">keepers of a temple</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:2:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 32, 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insularius: <entryFree id="n24044" type="main" key="insu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n24044.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A tenant of an</hi> insula (post-Aug.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:15:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 15, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">CERDO INSVLAR.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2926</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24044.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A slave who had charge of an</hi> insula, <hi rend="ital">and collected the rents</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:203" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 203</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:8:16" default="NO">7, 8, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:3:5 al" default="NO">14, 3, 5 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
insulatus: <entryFree id="n24045" type="main" key="insu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made into an island</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insulated</hi> (post-class.): terrae, App. de Mundo, p. 73; Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 2.</sense></entryFree>
insulcatio: <entryFree id="n24046" type="main" key="insulca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insulcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>in-sulco</etym>, <sense id="n24046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a furrowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">making furrows</hi> in the ground, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Res Gest. Alex. M. Mai. 1:20" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Res Gest. Alex. M. Mai. 1, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insulco: <entryFree id="n24047" type="main" key="insulco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sulco</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to furrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make furrows</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulcat, insulcat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 155</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insulensis: <entryFree id="n24048" type="main" key="insu^lensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insŭlensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>insula</etym>, <sense id="n24048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an island</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insular</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ab insulense ad continentem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 54</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
insulosus: <entryFree id="n24049" type="main" key="insu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of islands</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">mare Persicum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 10 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
insulse: <entryFree id="n24050" type="main" key="insulse_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insulsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. insulsus <sense id="n24050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
insulsitas: <entryFree id="n24051" type="main" key="insulsi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insulsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>insulsus</etym>. <sense id="n24051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tastelessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insipidity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">absurdity</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">insipientia insulsitasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harum rerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 11</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:82:284" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 82, 284</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insulsus: <entryFree id="n24052" type="main" key="insulsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insulsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-salsus</etym>, <sense id="n24052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unsalted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insipid.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24052.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">amurcā insulsā perfundunt sulcos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gula,</quote> <trans><tr>that longs for tasteless things</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 31, 4</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus insulsior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22, 40</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24052.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24052.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Bungling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">awkward</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyndaris illa bipennem insulsam et fatuam dextra laevaque tenebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:658" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 658</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24052.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Tasteless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insipid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">absurd</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non insulsum huic ingeniumst,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est etiam in verbo positum non insulsum genus (ridiculi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa (in sermone) nec illitterata, nec insulsa esse videntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acuti, nec insulsi hominis sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulsissimus homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:17:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 17, 12</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">insulsae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc mulieres), <hi rend="ital">silly creatures</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 2</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">insulsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">tastelessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insipidly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foolishly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">absurdly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulse, arroganter dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non insulse interpretari,</quote> <trans><tr>not amiss</tr>, <tr>not badly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 54</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil potest dici insulsius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec etiam addit insulsissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:2:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insultabundus: <entryFree id="n24053" type="main" key="insulta_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insultābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>insulto</etym>, <sense id="n24053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">insulting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full of scorn</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 86" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 86</bibl> ad Casul.</sense></entryFree>
insultatio: <entryFree id="n24054" type="main" key="insulta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insultātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n24054.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a springing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leaping over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">on</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 52, 20</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24054.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">insolent behavior</hi> towards any one, <hi rend="ital">a scoffing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reviling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insulting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil insultatione barbarorum intolerantius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:36" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insultatorie: <entryFree id="n24055" type="main" key="insulta_to_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insultātōrĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. insultatorius <sense id="n24055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
insultatorius: <entryFree id="n24056" type="main" key="insulta_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insultātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>insulto</etym>, <sense id="n24056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">scornful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mocking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insulting</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">verbum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 10</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sultātōrĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">scornfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insultingly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insultatrix: <entryFree id="n24057" type="main" key="insulta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insultātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>insultator</etym>, <sense id="n24057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that scoffs at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reviles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insults</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 5, 23, 1</bibl>. <pb n="972" /> <cb n="INSU" /></sense></entryFree>
insulto: <entryFree id="n24058" type="main" key="insulto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insulto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n24058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [insilio], <hi rend="ital">to spring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leap at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to leap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jump</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spring.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24058.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fores calcibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">floribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub armis Insultare solo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">busto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctibus insultavere carinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Batavi dum insultant aquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:8:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 8, 20</bibl></cit> (2, 8, b. 4. M.).—</sense><sense id="n24058.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemora avia matres Insultant thiasis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:580" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 580</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24058.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: fremit aequore toto Insultans sonipes. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:599" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 599</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24058.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to behave insolently towards</hi> any one, <hi rend="ital">to scoff at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insult</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui in calamitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:48:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 48, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui per contumelias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:62:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 62, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversis rebus eorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 29, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:571" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 571</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casibus alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:8:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24058.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: multos bonos, Sall. Fragm. ap. Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 9, 643</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patientiam et segnitiam cujuspiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 59</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24058.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24058.7" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">morte mea,</quote> <trans><tr>at my death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit> (4, 5), 24.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe impune se insultaturos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cernis ut insultent Rutuli,</quote> <trans><tr>exult</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insultura: <entryFree id="n24059" type="hapax" key="insultu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insultūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a springing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leaping at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi> a thing (opp. desultura), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insultus: <entryFree id="n24060" type="main" key="insultus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insultus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a scoffing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reviling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insult</hi> (eccl. Lat.): insultus et saevae jurgia turbae, Poët. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Carm. de Pass. Chr. 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insulula: <entryFree id="n24061" type="spur" key="insu^lu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insŭlŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, false reading for insula, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:37:section=85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 37, § 85</bibl> Lamb.</entryFree>
insum: <entryFree id="n24062" type="main" key="insum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sum</orth>, <itype>fui, esse</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24062.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">meo patri torulus inerit aureus sub petaso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummi octingenti aurei in marsupio infuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec digitis anulus ullus inest,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F 4, 658</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comae insunt capiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inerant lunaria fronti cornua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:687" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 687</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24062.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of abstract things, <hi rend="ital">to be contained in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to belong</hi> or <hi rend="ital">appertain to.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24062.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">superstitio, in qua inest inanis timor deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imagines divinitate praeditas inesse in universitate rerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vita nihil insit, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium aliquod inesse in moribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:37:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 37, 13</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24062.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus artibus prudentia major inest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui virile ingenium inest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic homini non minor veritas inerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tarda solet magnis rebus inesse fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 130</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24062.5" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">inest tamen aliquid, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipue pedum pernicitas inerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inerat contemptor animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 64:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 64, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inerat conscientia, derisui fuisse nuper falsum e Germania triumphum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insumo: <entryFree id="n24063" type="main" key="insu_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sūmo</orth>, <itype>mpsi, mptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take for</hi> any thing; hence <hi rend="ital">to apply to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expend upon.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24063.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24063.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">In aliquid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nullus teruncius insumatur in quemquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptum in aliquam rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:38:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 38, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sestertios tricenos in cenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:24:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 24, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24063.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucos dies reficiendae classi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 53</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24063.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est melius quo insumere possis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 102</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24063.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24063.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To apply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">employ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bestow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">operam frustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operam libellis accusatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam versibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24063.7" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec in evolvenda antiquitate satis operae insumitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 29</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24063.8" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis cura ad speculandum hoc malum insumitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 46, 70, § 153</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24063.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To take to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assume</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interficiendi domini animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medium latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:39" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignas insumite mentes Coeptibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 643</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24063.10" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To use up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhaust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weaken</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:2:60" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis virtutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:37:213" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Acut. 2, 37, 213</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insumptio: <entryFree id="n24064" type="main" key="insumpti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insumptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>insumo</etym>, <sense id="n24064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">expense</hi> (late Lat.): sportularum, Cod. Th. 6, 24, 3. — </sense><sense id="n24064.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Exhaustion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:38:172" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 38, 172</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insumptum: <entryFree id="n24065" type="main" key="insumptum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insumptum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">expense</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptus, insumptum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> 68</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insuo: <entryFree id="n24066" type="main" key="insu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi</itype>, ūtum. <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sew in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sew up in.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24066.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in culleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:25:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 25, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 5</bibl>: asinum jugulare, totisque vacuefactum praecordiis, per mediam alvum <cb n="INSU" /> virginem insuere, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 187</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terga boum plumbo insuto,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the cestus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 405</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24066.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem culleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:23:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 23, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilos vulneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 5, 32, § 99</bibl></cit> (al. inseruere): <cit><quote lang="la">patrio tener (infans) insuitur femori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 312</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insutum vestibus aurum,</quote> <trans><tr>embroidered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 131</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24066.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Phryges insuerent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Hab. Mulier. 1</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:51:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 51, 2</bibl>, the correct reading is imposuerat).</sense></entryFree>
insuper: <entryFree id="n24067" type="main" key="insu^per"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sŭper</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> and <pos>prep.</pos> <sense id="n24067.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the top</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overhead.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24067.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cumulata videbis insuper esse aliis alia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insuper bipedalibus trabibus immissis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes insuper altos Imposuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cumulatis in aquas sarcinis, insuper incumbebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum muniunt undique parietes atque insuper camera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 55:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 55, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24067.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">From above</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed eam (manum) gravis insuper ictus Amputat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:610" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 610</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugum insuper imminens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 34, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 16</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24067.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">over and above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moreover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besides</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut satisfaciat mihi, atque adjuret Insuper, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parumne est quod amat, Ni sumptuosus insuper etiam siet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 4, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam insuper defraudat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si id parum est, insuper poenas expetite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:67:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 67, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendio etiam insuper imposito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insuper quam,</quote> <trans><tr>besides that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non negando minuendove, sed insuper amplificando ementiendoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:66" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec insuper addidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:593" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 593</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insuper habere, i. q. contemnere,</quote> <trans><tr>to make light of</tr>, <tr>to slight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:1" default="NO">4, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 107, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 154, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:43" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 7, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:9:17" default="NO">34, 9, 17</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24067.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Prep.</hi> with <case>acc.</case> and <case>abl.</case>, <hi rend="ital">over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">above.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24067.5" n="A" level="2"> With <case>acc.</case> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">insuper arbores trabem planam imponito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insuper eam exaequationem pila struatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 12, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24067.6" n="B" level="2"> With <case>abl.</case> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">insuper his, campi quod rex habet ipse Latinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (trabibus) insuper transtra sustinent culmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo (tigno) insuper collocata erat materies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. Hand, Turs. III. 383-387.</sense></entryFree>
insuperabilis: <entryFree id="n24068" type="main" key="insu^pe^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sŭpĕrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be passed over.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24068.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">insurmountable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">transitus Alpium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:ib. 36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 36</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24068.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24068.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unconquerable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caput bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:613" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 613</bibl></cit>.— Of a disease, <hi rend="ital">incurable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24068.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unavoidable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inevitable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:807" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 807</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessitas fati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">insŭpĕrābĭ-lĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unconquerably</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 5, 8.</sense></entryFree>
insuperatus: <entryFree id="n24069" type="main" key="insu^pe^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insŭpĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-supero</etym>, <sense id="n24069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unconquered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unconquerable</hi>, Max. Gall. 1, 34.</sense></entryFree>
insupero: <entryFree id="n24070" type="main" key="insu^pe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sŭpĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pass over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surpass;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">to conquer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper dux in proeliis insuperavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Res Gest. Alex. M. 3:3" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Res Gest. Alex. M. 3, 3</bibl></cit>, Mai.</sense></entryFree>
insupportabilis: <entryFree id="n24071" type="main" key="insupporta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insupportābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unsupportable</hi> (eccl. Lat.), (Hilar.) Anon. in Job, 1, 93.</sense></entryFree>
insurgo: <entryFree id="n24072" type="main" key="insurgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-surgo</orth>, <itype>surrexi, rectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <sense id="n24072.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To rise upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rise up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to</hi>: insurgite remis, <hi rend="ital">rise on your oars</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">ply your oars vigorously</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:560" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 560</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 207</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 189</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">remis insurgitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:14" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insurgit transtris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:ib. 1:450" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 450</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigro glomerari pulvere nubem Prospiciunt Teucri, ac tenebras insurgere campis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibilat insurgens capiti,</quote> <trans><tr>raising its head</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:546" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 546</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24072.1" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugum (i. q. in jugum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 103</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24072.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To raise one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mount</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insurgat Aquilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:10:7" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si forte prolapsus est, attolli et insurgere haud licitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:39:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 39, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altior insurgens et cursu concitus heros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:902" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 902</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et (serpens) sibilat ore, Arduus insurgens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 755</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acuta silex Speluncae dorso insurgens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde colles insurgunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pone tergum insurgebat silva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 16</bibl></cit>; so in fight, <hi rend="ital">to rise</hi> for a blow: <cit><quote lang="la">ostendit dextram insurgens Entellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:443" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 443</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:294" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 294</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24072.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24072.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To rise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grow in power</hi>: insurgere regnis alicujus, <hi rend="ital">to rise against</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to aim at seizing one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s kingdom</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 444</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar insurgere paulatim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanas opes insurgere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 16</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24072.5" n="2" level="3"> Of waters, floods: <cit><quote lang="la">vastius insurgens decimae ruit impetus undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 530</bibl></cit>: Atax usque <cb n="INTA" /> eo solitus insurgere, ut se ipse non capiat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 6, 6</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24072.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To arise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insurgunt fremitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:82" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 82</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24072.7" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To rise up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rouse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bestir one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invigilare publicis utilitatibus et insurgere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:66:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 66, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24072.8" n="5" level="3"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">to rise</hi> above the level of ordinary language, <hi rend="ital">to become sublime</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Horatius insurgit aliquando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:96" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">augeri debent sententiae, et insurgere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec sunt, quibus mens pariter et oratio insurgant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insurrectio: <entryFree id="n24073" type="gloss" key="insurrecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insurrectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>insurgo</etym>, <sense id="n24073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rising up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insurrection</hi>: insurrectio, <foreign lang="greek">e)pana/stasis,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
insusceptus: <entryFree id="n24074" type="main" key="insusceptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-susceptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not taken upon one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0800,001:1:197" default="NO"><author>Albin.</author> 1, 197</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insuspicabilis: <entryFree id="n24075" type="main" key="insuspi^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-suspĭcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not thought of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unexpected</hi> (eccl. Lat.); only <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24075.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">insuspĭcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one unexpected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not thought of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">portavit diadema,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sir. 11, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24075.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">insuspĭcābĭlĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">fancies</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imaginations</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insuspicabilia cordis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sir. 25, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insustentabilis: <entryFree id="n24076" type="main" key="insustenta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sustentābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unbearable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intolerable</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">dominatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mort. Pers. 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:16:100" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 16, 100</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insusurratio: <entryFree id="n24077" type="main" key="insu^surra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insŭsurrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>insusurro</etym>, <sense id="n24077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a whispering to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a suggesting</hi> (late Lat.), Capit. Marc. Aur. 19, 11.</sense></entryFree>
insusurro: <entryFree id="n24078" type="main" key="insu^surro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sŭsurro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n24078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to whisper in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">into</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">to; to insinuate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suggest.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24078.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24078.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:36:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 36, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aurem familiariter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:41:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 41, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo insusurrans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Cal. 22</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aurem ejus insusurratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:46:section=120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 46, § 120</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24078.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui cantilenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 19, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vota diis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insusurratum nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brev. Vit. 14</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24078.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non solum nauta significat, sed etiam Favonius ipse insusurrat, navigandi nobis tempus esse,</quote> <trans><tr>suggests to us</tr>, <tr>reminds us</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 48, 147</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insuticius: <entryFree id="n24079" type="spur" key="insu^ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insŭtīcĭus</orth>, <itype>false reading for insiticius</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 186</bibl>.</entryFree>
insutus: <entryFree id="n24080" type="main" key="insu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from insuo.</entryFree>
intabesco: <entryFree id="n24081" type="main" key="inta_besco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tābesco</orth>, <itype>bui, 3</itype>, <sense id="n24081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to waste away by degrees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pine away.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24081.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">diuturno morbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:35:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 35, 84</bibl></cit> (B. and K. tabescentem): <cit><quote lang="la">cum semel fixae cibo Intabuissent pupulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:39" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis intabescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutem videant intabescantque relictā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:38" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolori,</quote> <trans><tr>with grief</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Polyb. 24" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Polyb. 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24081.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to melt away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissolve</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut intabescere flavae Igne levi cerae solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:487" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 487</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lata plumbea funda Missa solet medio glans intabescere caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:826" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 826</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intactilis: <entryFree id="n24082" type="hapax" key="intacti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tactĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be touched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intangible</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 437</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intactus: <entryFree id="n24083" type="main" key="intactus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">untouched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uninjured</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intact.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24083.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervix juvencae,</quote> <trans><tr>not broken to the yoke</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:540" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 540</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:22" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus integer intactusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intactum aliquem inviolatumque dimittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">integri intactique fugerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:25" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello fines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnere miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:399" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 399</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arx bellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:661" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 661</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus ab vexatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intactus profugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Britannus,</quote> <trans><tr>unsubdued</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:7:7" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scythae perpetuo ab alieno imperio intacti, aut invicti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <trans><tr>unstained</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:77" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires,</quote> <trans><tr>unimpaired</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intactus superstitione,</quote> <trans><tr>free from superstition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir haud intacti religione animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intactus infamiā,</quote> <trans><tr>of spotless integrity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intacta invidiā media,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 35, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(triarii) per alios manipulos prope intacti evasere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput intactum buxo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:194" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 194</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24083.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24083.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Untried</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unattempted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prorsus nihil intactum, neque quietum pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 66</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <trans><tr>without combat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 83</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">novā intactāque ratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dryadum silvas saltusque sequamur Intactos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thensauros Proserpinae intactos ad eam diem spoliavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 18, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrilegas admovere manus intactis illis thensauris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 18, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intactis opulentior thesauris Arabum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of a play not yet acted: <cit><quote lang="la">esurit (Statius) intactam Paridi nisi vendat Agaven,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:87" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 87</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">intactum dicere carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:238" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 238</bibl></cit>: intacta carmina<pb n="973" /> <cb n="INTE" />  discens, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 67</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24083.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Untouched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undefiled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chaste</hi>, of virgins: <cit><quote lang="la">Pallas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui pater intactam dederat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 345</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intactior omni Sabina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:162" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 162</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam publica saltem his intacta malis agerentur sacra,</quote> <trans><tr>not disgraced by these scandals</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:336" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 336</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24084" type="main" key="intactus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tactus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n24084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">intangibleness</hi>, only in an interpolation in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 454</bibl>; cf. Lachm. and Munro ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
intaminabilis: <entryFree id="n24085" type="main" key="inta_mi^na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intāmĭnābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">undefilable</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Aug. contr. adv. Leg. and Bleph. 1, 50.</sense></entryFree>
intaminatus: <entryFree id="n24086" type="main" key="inta_mi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intāmĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-tamino; whence contamino</etym>, <sense id="n24086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unsullied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undefiled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus Intaminatis fulget honoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Milit. 15 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
intardo: <entryFree id="n24087" type="main" key="intardo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tardo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n24087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abide</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">intardans atque perseverans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:4:43" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 4, 43</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">part. pass. subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intardata corporibus emovere,</quote> <trans><tr>chronic disorders</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 2:3:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intectamentum: <entryFree id="n24088" type="gloss" key="intecta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intectāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>intego</etym>, <sense id="n24088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the covering of a roof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roofing</hi>: intectamentum, <foreign lang="greek">ske/pasma ste/ghs,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
intectus: <entryFree id="n24089" type="main" key="intectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from intego.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24090" type="main" key="intectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uncovered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unclad.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24090.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuda, intecta corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semiruta moenia, domūs intectae,</quote> <trans><tr>unroofed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera intecti,</quote> <trans><tr>with no other covering</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux prope intectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 22</bibl></cit>: pedes, <hi rend="ital">uncovered</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">with only sandals on them</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 77</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nudum et intectum corpus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 10</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24090.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">unconcealed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frank</hi> (opp. obscurus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
integellus: <entryFree id="n24091" type="main" key="inte^gellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕgellus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n24091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [integer], <hi rend="ital">pretty safe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tolerably uninjured</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">sumbiwth/s,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 10, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with castus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 15, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
