integer: <entryFree id="n24092" type="main" key="inte^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕger</orth>, <itype>tē^gra, tē^grum</itype> (long e in intēgri, intēgros, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:927" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 927</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:113 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 113 al.</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in and root tag-, tango</etym>, <sense id="n24092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">untouched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unhurt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unchanged.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24092.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24092.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Undiminished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">integer et plenus thensaurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 12, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quarum (sublicarum) pars inferior integra remanebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">integris bonis exulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec superstes Integer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer malasque comamque Integer,</quote> <trans><tr>with beard</tr>, <tr>and hair on his head</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:487" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 487</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa (litterarum),</quote> <trans><tr>unbroken</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: ad integrum, <hi rend="ital">wholly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entirely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpore carens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Som. Scip. 1, 5</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24092.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unimpaired</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uninjured</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unhurt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unwounded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unmutilated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unexhausted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fresh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigorous.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24092.4" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescens cum sis, tum, cum est sanguis integer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum recentes atque integri defessis successissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 94</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. defessi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 41</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. defatigati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 48</bibl></cit>; 5, 16; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">integris viribus repugnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ad quietem integri iremus, opp. onustus cibo et vino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">integra valetudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 20, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">integrum se salvumque velle,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus rebus integros incolumesque esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florentes atque integri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">integros pro sauciis arcessere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 60:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 60, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. saucius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:25:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 25, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Horatius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nasus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:56" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:288" default="NO">10, 288</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. truncus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 11, 10</bibl></cit>. § <cit><quote lang="la">50: cecidit Cethegus integer, et jacuit Catilina cadavere toto,</quote> <trans><tr>not mutilated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:288" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 288</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes, opp. accisae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier aetate integra,</quote> <trans><tr>in the flower of her age</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora sana et integri sanguinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8 praef" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8 praef.</bibl></cit> § 19; <cit><quote lang="la">tantum capite integro (opp. transfigurato),</quote> <trans><tr>unchanged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam integerrimis corporibus cibum offerre,</quote> <trans><tr>free from fever</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antequam ex toto integer fiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">integra aetate ac valetudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 10</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24092.5" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">integer aevi sanguis (= integri aevi sanguis, i. e. juvenilis vigor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:638" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 638</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 255</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:441" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 441</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">integer annorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:415" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 415</bibl></cit> (cf. II. A. infra): deos aevi integros, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 9, 255</bibl> (Trag. v. 440 Vahl.). — </sense><sense id="n24092.6" n="3" level="3"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama et fortunis integer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H 2:41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H 2, 41, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiis integra (regio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 1:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque aetate neque corpore integer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 19</bibl></cit>: pectore maturo fuerat puer <cb n="INTE" /> integer aevo, Ped. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0800,001:3:5" default="NO"><author>Albin.</author> 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum vernat sanguis, dum rugis integer annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 5, 59.—</sense><sense id="n24092.7" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">a</hi> (<hi rend="ital">ab</hi>) and <case>abl.</case> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">a populi suffragiis integer,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>who has not been rejected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 52</bibl></cit> D.: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes integrae ab labore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens integra a cladibus belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 41, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24092.8" n="5" level="3"> Esp. in phrase ad or in integrum (sc. statum), <hi rend="ital">to a former condition</hi> or <hi rend="ital">state</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">potius quam redeat ad integrum haec eadem oratio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to have the same story over again</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod te absente hic filius egit restitui in integrum aequum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos ego non idcirco esse arbitror in integrum restitutos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:36:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 36, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 32, 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(judicia) in integrum restituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24092.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Not worn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fresh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">new</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unused</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad integrum bellum cuncta parare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 73:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 73, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 108:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 108, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnam edere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9, 13</bibl></cit>.—Hence, esp. <pos>adv.</pos>: de integro, ab integro, ex integro, <hi rend="ital">anew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afresh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mihi de integro scribendi causa non sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:60:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 60, 167</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acrius de integro obortum est bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relata de integro res ad senatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnam efficere ab integro novam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:56:section=147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 56, § 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnus ab integro saeclorum nascitur ordo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recipere ex integro vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navibus ex integro fabricatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 16</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24092.10" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Untainted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fresh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sweet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut anteponantur integra contaminatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:18:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 18, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 26, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 4, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aper, opp. vitiatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24092.11" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Not before attempted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fresh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex integra Graeca integram comoediam Hodie sum acturus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alias ut uti possim causa hac integra,</quote> <trans><tr>this pretext as a fresh one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum Plautus locum reliquit integrum,</quote> <trans><tr>not treated</tr>, <tr>not imitated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:prol. 9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. prol. 9</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n24092.12" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24092.13" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Blameless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irreproachable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spotless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtuous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illo nemo neque integrior esset in civitate, neque sanctior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(homines) integri, innocentes, religiosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:4:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 4, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">integerrima vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incorrupti atque integri testes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">integer urbis,</quote> <trans><tr>not spoiled by the city</tr>, <tr>untainted with city vices</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:374" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 374</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir a multis vitiis integer, Sen. de Ira, 1, 18, 3.— Of female chastity: loquere filiam meam quis integram stupraverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">narratque, ut virgo ab se integra etiam tum siet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus liberos conjugesque suas integras ab istius petulantia conservare non licitum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24092.14" n="B" level="2"> Of the <hi rend="ital">mind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disposition.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24092.15" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Free from passion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prejudice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unbiassed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impartial</hi>: integrum se servare, <hi rend="ital">to keep one's self neutral</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 26, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:80" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scopulis surdior Icari Voces audit, adhuc integer,</quote> <trans><tr>untouched with love</tr>, <tr>heart-whole</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia et vultum teretesque suras Integer laudo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24092.16" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Healthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sane</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unimpaired</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 65</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:31:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 31, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a conjuratione,</quote> <trans><tr>without complicity in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">integrius judicium a favore et odio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:37:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 37, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24092.17" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">New</hi> to a thing, <hi rend="ital">ignorant</hi> of it: <cit><quote lang="la">rudem me discipulum, et integrum accipe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffragiis integer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 52</bibl></cit> Dietsch—</sense><sense id="n24092.18" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">In which nothing has yet been done</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undecided</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undetermined</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">integram rem et causam relinquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem integram ad reditum suum jussit esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 23, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">integram omnem causam reservare alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea dicam, quae ipsi, re integra saepe dixi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quam integerrima ad pacem essent omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offensiones,</quote> <trans><tr>not yet cancelled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">integrum est mihi,</quote> <trans><tr>it is still in my power</tr>, <tr>I am at liberty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loquor de legibus promulgatis, de quibus est integrum vobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est integrum, Cn. Pompeio consilio jam uti tuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei ne integrum quidem erat, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:21:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 21, 62</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">So, integrum dare,</quote> <trans><tr>to grant full power</tr>, <tr>to leave at liberty</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 38</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕgrē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n24092.19" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">wholly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entirely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24092.20" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24092.21" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Irreproachably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honestly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">justly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incorrupte atque integre judicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in amicorum periculis caste integreque versatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 1</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cb n="INTE" /> quid dici potest integrius, quid incorruptius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 22</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asiam integerrime administravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procuratione integerrime functus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 25</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24092.22" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Purely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">correctly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">integre et ample et ornate dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:4:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proprie atque integre loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:11:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 11, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intego: <entryFree id="n24093" type="main" key="inte^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tĕgo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">villam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turres coriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliqua pars scrobis viminibus ac virgultis integebatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum prima luce densa nebula saltum camposque intexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:17:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 17, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">casside crines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:303" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 303</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Clitumnus flumina luco Integit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 15</bibl></cit> (3, 12), 25: <cit><quote lang="la">statuas auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 4, 9, § 15</bibl></cit>: viam, <hi rend="ital">to arch over</hi>, Inscr. ap. Grut. 150, 1.—</sense><sense id="n24093.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To protect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidit cum loci altitudine tum vallo etiam integi Romanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 23, 6</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
integrasco: <entryFree id="n24094" type="hapax" key="inte^grasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕgrasco</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <sense id="n24094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [integro], <hi rend="ital">to renew itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">begin anew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break out afresh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc malum integrascit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
integratio: <entryFree id="n24095" type="main" key="inte^gra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕgrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a renewing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restoring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amantium irae amoris integratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei familiaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 3:73" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 3, 73</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
integrator: <entryFree id="n24096" type="main" key="inte^gra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕgrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a renewer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restorer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Ap. 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
integre: <entryFree id="n24097" type="main" key="inte^gre_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕgrē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. integer <sense id="n24097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
integritas: <entryFree id="n24098" type="main" key="inte^gri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕgrĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>integer</etym>, <sense id="n24098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the undiminished</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unimpaired condition</hi> of a thing. </sense><sense id="n24098.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24098.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Completeness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sound ness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:11:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 11, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 14</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 34</bibl></cit>: integritatis testes mihi desunt, i. e. testiculi, Phaedr, 3, 11: integritas, <hi rend="ital">freedom from fever</hi>, Cels 3, 5: <cit><quote lang="la">saporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24098.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the whole</hi> (opp. pars): <cit><quote lang="la">cum pars movetur, quiescente integritate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 14, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 7, 16, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">universa philosophiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 17, 17</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24098.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24098.5" n="A" level="2"> Of the intellectual powers: <cit><quote lang="la">non eandem esse vim neque integritatem dormientium et vigilantium nec mente nec sensu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 17, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">integritas mentis,</quote> <trans><tr>soundness of mind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:1:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24098.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Blamelessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">innocence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">integrity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">integritas atque innocentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic provinciae praefuit in pace, ut et civibus et sociis gratissima esset ejus integritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnes aequitatem tuam, temperantiam, severitatem, integritatem laudent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes ita de tua virtute, integritate, humanitate commemorant, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Phoc. 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24098.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Chastity</hi> of females: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierem summa integritate pudicitiaque existimari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">virginitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24098.8" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Purity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">correctness</hi> of language: <cit><quote lang="la">Latini sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
integritudo: <entryFree id="n24099" type="main" key="inte^gri^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕgrĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>inis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">soundness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">integrity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
integro: <entryFree id="n24100" type="main" key="inte_^gro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intē^gro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make whole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renew.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24100.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24100.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To restore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repair</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnes Integrant mare,</quote> <trans><tr>supply</tr>, <tr>keep full</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1032" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1032</bibl></cit>: omnia debet enim cibus integrare novando, <hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">keep entire by renewing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 1146</bibl>: ut mea ope opes Trojae integrem, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 127, 1</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 124 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">elapsos in pravum artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 81</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24100.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To renew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">begin again</hi>: integrare caedem, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 127, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicitiam, Pac. ib. (Trag. Rel. v. 111 Rib.): pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:657" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 657</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 514</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immania vulnera,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>by relating</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:29" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24100.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to recreate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refresh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus defessus audiendo aut admiratione integratur, aut risu novatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modicis honestisque inter bibendum remissionibus refici integrarique animos ad, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:2:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
integulatus: <entryFree id="n24101" type="main" key="inte^gu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕgŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>2. in-tegula</etym>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not tiled</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 128:11" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 128, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
integumentum: <entryFree id="n24102" type="main" key="inte^gu^mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕgŭmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>intego</etym>, <sense id="n24102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24102.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanx cum integumentis, quae Jovi adposita fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>the plate-covers</tr>, <tr>lids</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:59:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 59, 7</bibl></cit> Weissenb. (al. lana cum integumentis, i. e. the pillows on which rested the heads of the statues of the gods): <cit><quote lang="la">ea legio linteata ab integumento consaepti ... appellata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:38:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 38, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis aut pellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Orig. Gent. Rom. 13:2" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Orig. Gent. Rom. 13, 2</bibl></cit>: integumenta carnalia, Ambros. de Isaac et An. 4, 16.—</sense><sense id="n24102.2" n="II" level="1"> Transf <pb n="974" /> <cb n="INTE" /> </sense><sense id="n24102.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That which conceals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a covering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> post Red. in Sen. 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:20:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 20, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissimulationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornamenta ejus ingenii per quaedam involucra atque integumenta perspexi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequitia frontis involuta integumentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24102.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That which protects</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a defence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shelter</hi>: corporis alicujus, <hi rend="ital">one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s constant attendant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 2, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetati meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intellectio: <entryFree id="n24103" type="main" key="intellecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intellectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>intellego</etym>, <sense id="n24103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">synecdoche</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 33, 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intellectivus: <entryFree id="n24104" type="main" key="intellecti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intellectīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">qewrhtiko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n24104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dependent on discernment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">theoretical</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Gen. ad Lit. 12:7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Gen. ad Lit. 12, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intellector: <entryFree id="n24105" type="main" key="intellector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intellector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id</etym>, <sense id="n24105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who understands</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doctr. Christ. 2:13" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doctr. Christ. 2, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intellectualis: <entryFree id="n24106" type="main" key="intellectu^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intellectŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. intellectus</etym>, <sense id="n24106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to the understanding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intellectual</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. p. 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Gen. ad Lit. 12:7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Gen. ad Lit. 12, 7</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">intellectŭā-lĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">intellectually</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. An. 2, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intellectualitas: <entryFree id="n24107" type="main" key="intellectu^a_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intellectŭālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>intellectualis</etym>, <sense id="n24107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">understanding</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
intellectus: <entryFree id="n24108" type="main" key="intellectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intellectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from intellego.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24109" type="main" key="intellectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intellectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>intellego</etym>, <sense id="n24109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a perceiving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discerning.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24109.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">perception</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discernment</hi> by the senses: <cit><quote lang="la">saporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 65, § 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acrimoniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 8, 54, § 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec est intellectus ullus in odore vel sapore,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the poison cannot be perceived either by the taste or smell</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 53, 116, § 280</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellectus in cortice protinus peritis,</quote> <trans><tr>good judges know a tree by its bark</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 39, 76, § 196</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24109.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24109.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Understanding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comprehension</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quīs neque boni intellectus neque mali cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus rei intellectum amittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capere intellectum disciplinarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellectu consequi aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elephantis intellectus sermonis patrii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum animal minus docile existimatur minorisve intellectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 6, 34, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissimulare intellectum insidiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellectu carere,</quote> <trans><tr>to be unintelligible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudis Corinthiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:13:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: intellectum habere, <hi rend="ital">to be understood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiems et ver et aestas intellectum ac vocabula habent, autumni perinde nomen ac bona ignorantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 26</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24109.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Meaning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">signification</hi> of a word: <cit><quote lang="la">verba quaedam diversos intellectus habent, ut cerno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in obscenum intellectum sermo detortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 7, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24109.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Knowledge</hi> of a language, <hi rend="ital">understanding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latini sermonis intellectum habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:93" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 93</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24109.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Understanding</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the faculty of understanding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intellect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per analogiam nostro intellectu et honestum et bonum judicante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 120" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in errorem intellectum inducere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellectu carere,</quote> <trans><tr>to be without understanding</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:2:92" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 2, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem intellectum habere, ... nullum intellectum habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:109" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 109</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intellegens: <entryFree id="n24110" type="main" key="intelle^gens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intellĕgens</orth>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. intellego <sense id="n24110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
intellegenter: <entryFree id="n24111" type="main" key="intelle^genter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intellĕgenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. intellego <sense id="n24111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
intellegentia: <entryFree id="n24112" type="main" key="intelle^genti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intellĕgentĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">intellĭg-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>intellego</etym>, <sense id="n24112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the power of discerning</hi> or <hi rend="ital">understanding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discernment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">understanding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intelligence.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24112.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deus intellegentiam in animo inclusit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellegentia est, per quam animus ea perspicit, quae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars animi, rationis atque intellegentiae particeps,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Div. 1, 32, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infixam nostram intellegentiam capere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:19:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 19, 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fretus intellegentia vestra dissero brevius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 19, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in nostram intellegentiam cadit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 9</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratione et intellegentia tenere aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 17</bibl></cit> al.—</sense><sense id="n24112.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24112.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Understanding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knowledge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia difficilis erat animi, quid, aut qualis esset, intellegentia, nullum omnino animum esse dixerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae nos magis ad cognitionem intellegentiamque convertant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 5</bibl></cit>: somniorum, <hi rend="ital">the knowledge of dreams</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the art of interpreting dreams</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam calamitatem vestra intellegentia sedabit,</quote> <trans><tr>discrimination</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:prol. 23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. prol. 23</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24112.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum omnium quasi adumbratas intellegentias animo ac mente concipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 22</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24112.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n24112.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Art</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">connoisseurship</hi>: intellegentia<cb n="INTE" />  in rusticis rebus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in homine intellegentiam esse, non avaritiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:21:section=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 21, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae quaerendae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24112.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Perception</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discernment</hi> by the senses: <cit><quote lang="la">in gustu et odoratu intellegentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 4, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intellegibilis: <entryFree id="n24113" type="main" key="intelle^gi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intellĕgĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>intellego</etym>. <sense id="n24113.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That can be understood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intelligible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intellectual</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonum (opp. intellegibile),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 124:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 124, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Soliloq. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Soliloq. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24113.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Perceptible</hi> to the senses, <hi rend="ital">sensible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in corporis intellegibilis lineam (dyas) prima defluxit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6, 19</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">intellĕgĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">intelligibly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 218" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 218</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intellego: <entryFree id="n24114" type="main" key="intelle^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intellĕgo</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">intellĭgo</orth>), <itype>exi, ectum</itype> (intellexti for intellexisti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 32, 3</bibl>: <sense id="n24114.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">intellexes for intellexisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 81</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">subj. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellegerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 1:41:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 1, 41, 23</bibl></cit> Dietsch), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>inter-lego</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to see into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">understand.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24114.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24114.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To perceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">understand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comprehend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualem autem deum intellegere nos possumus nulla virtute praeditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:15:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 15, 38</bibl></cit> Schoemann ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec dumtaxat in Graecis intellego, quae ipsi, qui scripserunt, voluerunt a vulgo intellegi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puderet me dicere non intellegere, si vos ipsi intellegeretis, qui ista defenditis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus quid sit intellego,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare autem in his vis deorum insit, tum intellegam cum cognovero,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam sis audax hinc omnes intellegere potuerunt, quod,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna ex parvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellexi ex tuis litteris, te audisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de gestu intellego, quid respondeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:chapter=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellegere et sapere plus quam ceteros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cernere aliquid animo atque intellegere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:chapter=5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile intellectu est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion. 9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellegi necesse est: esse deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quocirca intellegi necesse est, in ipsis rebus invitamenta inesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 11</bibl></cit>.—In answers, intellego corresponds to our <hi rend="ital">I understand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very well</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 93</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Abl. absol.</hi>: intellecto; with <hi rend="ital">rel. clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam bonorum caesi, postquam, intellecto in quos saeviretur, pessimi quoque arma rapuerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 49</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">intellecto quantum bellum suscitaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:3:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24114.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to have an accurate knowledge of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">skill in</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to be a connoisseur</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciunt intellegendo ut nihil intellegant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:prol. 17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. prol. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tametsi non multum in istis rebus intellego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc nugatorium sciebam esse, ista intellegere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">33: quoniam non intellexerunt in operibus domini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 13, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi qui linguam ejus intellegebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0972,001:73:3" default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> S. 73, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Apoc. 5:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Apoc. 5, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24114.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To distinguish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oraculorum praestigias profani a veritate intellegere non possunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 16</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24114.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To see</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observe</hi> by the understanding: <cit><quote lang="la">vehementer nunc mihi est irata: sentio atque intellego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi neque cohortationes suas neque preces audiri intellegit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi, ante inito, ut intellectum est, consilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellego, quid loquar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24114.6" n="E" level="2"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">to understand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comprehend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">judge rightly</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod Catonem aetas sua parum intellexisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:de Const. Sap. 1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> de Const. Sap. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando Socrates ab hominibus sui temporis parum intellegebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:114:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 114, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem legatum tribunus ita et intellexit et cepit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 23, 5</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24114.7" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To understand</hi> a language: isti qui linguam avium intellegunt, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:57:131" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 57, 131</bibl> (Trag. v. 83 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">in iis linguis quas non intellegimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:40:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 40, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum ego Graece scripta intellegere possum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:13:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 13, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguam ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:de M. Claud. 5:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> de M. Claud. 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 73</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24114.8" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To understand</hi> by any thing, <hi rend="ital">to take</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">to mean.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24114.9" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sub</hi> aliqua re, or <hi rend="ital">per</hi> aliquid: illa est <foreign lang="greek">eu)taci/a,</foreign> in qua intellegitur ordinis conservatio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:40:142" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 40, 142</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub hoc themate intellegere non hoc, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 9:28:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 9, 28, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellego sub hoc verbo multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 1:2:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per nemo homo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Donat.</author> ad Ter. Eun. 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solem sub appellatione Jovis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 23, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per sagittas vim radiorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17, 12</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24114.10" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">two acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non habeo quod intellegam bonum illud,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:18:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 18, 41</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24114.11" n="3" level="3"> With <case>acc.</case> and <case>abl.</case>: consuetudo omnibus<cb n="INTE" />  his nominibus Argesten intellegi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 46, § 121</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24114.12" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to perceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discern</hi> by the senses; <hi rend="ital">to see</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notice.</hi> Alcumenam ante aedis stare saturam intellego, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 35</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Si.</hi> Statum vide hominis, Callipho.... <hi rend="ital">Ca.</hi> Bene confidenterque astitisse intellego, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa quidem primo nullos intellegit ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 456</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arbor. 13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arbor. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia hominum intellegi a feris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 21, § 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:55" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 4, 14, § 55</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tellĕgens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">that has understanding</hi> or <hi rend="ital">that understands</hi> a thing; <hi rend="ital">intelligent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquainted with.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24114.13" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">semperne vulgi judicium cum intellegentium judicio congruit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellegens dicendi existimator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:Or. 4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. Or. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujusvis generis ejus intellegens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 20</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid intellegentiore mente discutere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Retract. 1:19" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Retract. 1, 19</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24114.14" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n24114.15" n="1" level="3"> Intellegens alicujus, <hi rend="ital">that understands a person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rightly estimates his character</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellegens principis nostri, cujus videbam hanc esse laudem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 27, 2</bibl></cit> Döring ad loc.— </sense><sense id="n24114.16" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Well skilled in matters of taste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a connoisseur</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa pulcherrima quae non modo istum hominem, ingeniosum atque intellegentem, verum etiam quemvis nostrum, quos iste idiotas appellat, delectare possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut putetur in istis rebus intellegens esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl></cit>. 4, 15, § 33.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">intellĕgenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">intelligently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut amice, ut intelligenter, ut attente audiamur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 8, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 16, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intelligo: <entryFree id="n24115" type="main" key="intelli^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intellĭgo</orth>, v. intellego.</entryFree>
intemelii: <entryFree id="n24116" type="main" key="Inte^me^li^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Intĕmĕlĭi</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Intĭm-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n24116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people on the coast of Liguria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the foot of the Maritime Alps</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 41, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 7</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Their capital</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Albium Intemelium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 7, § 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intemerabilis: <entryFree id="n24117" type="main" key="inte^me^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕmĕrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-temero</etym>, <sense id="n24117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inviolable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: laus, epith. in Anth. Lat. T. II. p. 640, v. 71.</sense></entryFree>
intemerandus: <entryFree id="n24118" type="main" key="inte^me^randus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tĕmĕrandus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may not be profaned</hi> or <hi rend="ital">violated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Martia templa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:642" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 642</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intemerate: <entryFree id="n24119" type="main" key="inte^me^ra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕmĕrātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. intemeratus <sense id="n24119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
intemeratus: <entryFree id="n24120" type="main" key="inte^me^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tĕmĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">undefiled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unviolated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inviolate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chaste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virgin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Camilla) virginitatis amorem Intemerata colit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:584" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 584</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munera,</quote> <trans><tr>pure gifts</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Penelope, inter tot juvenes procos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim per hos dies inausum intemeratumve vobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra incorrupta et intemerata servare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:270" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 270</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">integrum et intemeratum beneficium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <trans><tr>unviolated</tr>.</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intemeratior cunctis virginibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:724" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 724</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕmĕ-rātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">incorruptly</hi>: popularibus plausibus servire (al. intemperanter), Cod. Th. 15, 5, 3.</sense></entryFree>
intemperabilis: <entryFree id="n24121" type="hapax" key="intempe^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tempĕrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not to be moderated</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:124" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 124</bibl> dub. (al. intemporalis).</sense></entryFree>
intemperans: <entryFree id="n24122" type="main" key="intempe^rans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tempĕrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">intemper,</hi> <hi rend="ital">ate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immoderate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24122.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">intemperans atque immoderata permixtio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 11</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 6:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 6, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24122.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24122.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That cannot govern himself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without moderation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extravagant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immoderate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intemperate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intemperantis esse arbitror scribere, quod occultari velit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fui paulo intemperantior fortasse, quam debui,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>I ought to have exhibited more moderation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intemperans sum in ejus rei cupiditate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intemperans militaris in forti viro gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in augendo eo non alius intemperantior est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avidi atque intemperantes animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in voluptates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad vescendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 6" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24122.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Incontinent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profligate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">debauched</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter impudicas mulieres, et intemperantes viros versari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:68:section=160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 68, § 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinosa et intemperans adulescentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 9, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impurissima atque intemperantissima pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 29</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">intempĕranter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">immoderately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extravagantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intemperately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis iracunde hoc quidem, et valde intemperanter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: intemperanter abuti et otio et litteris, <pb n="975" /> <cb n="INTE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacerare aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 5</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne intemperantius opibus suis utatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:68" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 68</bibl></cit>: adesse adversus aliquem. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 38</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intemperantissime gloriari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 321, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intemperantia: <entryFree id="n24123" type="main" key="intempe^ranti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intempĕrantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>intemperans</etym>, <sense id="n24123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">want of mildness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intemperateness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inclemency.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24123.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. Sap. 9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. Sap. 9</bibl></cit>; Col. prooem. 1, § 3.—</sense><sense id="n24123.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24123.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Want of moderation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extravagance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intemperance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium perturbationum fontem esse dicunt intemperantiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:9:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">menti inimica intemperantia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 9, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini,</quote> <trans><tr>the immoderate use of wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbo et intemperantiā perire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:62" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">risūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 80, § 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 106" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatis, donec unus eligatur, multos destinandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legitima, said of a second marriage,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24123.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">want of moderation</hi> in one's conduct towards others; <hi rend="ital">haughtiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrogance; insolence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impudence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insubordination</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pausaniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Arist. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Arist. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suā intemperantiā, nimiāque licentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eum. 8, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intemperate: <entryFree id="n24124" type="main" key="intempe^ra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intempĕrātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. intemperatus <sense id="n24124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
intemperatus: <entryFree id="n24125" type="main" key="intempe^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tempĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">untempered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inclement.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24125.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ad caeli naturam intemperatius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence: intemperatum vinum,</quote> <trans><tr>unmixed wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:17:section=158" default="NO"><author>Cael.
