Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 17, § 158</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24125.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">immoderate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intemperate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">benevolentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 20</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">intempĕ-rātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">intemperately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">immoderate et intemperate vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intemperiae: <entryFree id="n24126" type="main" key="intempe^ri^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intempĕrĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <number>plur.</number> [2. intemperies], <sense id="n24126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">intemperateness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inclemency.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24126.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of the weather: <cit><quote lang="la">calamitates intemperiasque prohibessis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 141</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24126.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">folly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">madness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insanity</hi>: Quae te intemperiae tenent? <hi rend="ital">what storm has got hold of you?</hi> i. e. <hi rend="ital">what are you raving about?</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">larvae hunc atque intemperiae insaniaeque agitant senem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 39</bibl>: intemperiarum pleni, <hi rend="ital">disquietude</hi>, Gell. praef. § 19.</sense></entryFree>
intemperies: <entryFree id="n24127" type="main" key="intempe^ri^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tempĕrĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n24127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">intemperateness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inclemency.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24127.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum,</quote> <trans><tr>immoderate rains</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 31</bibl></cit>.— Hence, transf., <hi rend="ital">a tempest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">storm</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">calamity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intemperies modo in nostram advenit domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24127.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24127.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Intemperate behavior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outrageous conduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">madness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insanity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">folly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:23:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 23, 11</bibl></cit>: intemperies ista quae <foreign lang="greek">melagxoli/a</foreign> dicitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:7:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 18, 7, 4</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">has ejus (Xanthippes) intemperies in maritum demirari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:17:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 17, 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24127.4" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">intemperance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ebrietatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:13:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 13, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intempestive: <entryFree id="n24128" type="main" key="intempesti_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intempestīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. intempestivus <sense id="n24128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
intempestivitas: <entryFree id="n24129" type="main" key="intempesti_vi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intempestīvĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>intempestivus</etym>, <sense id="n24129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unseasonableness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensis octavi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a premature birth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:16:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 16, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intempestiviter: <entryFree id="n24130" type="main" key="intempesti_vi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intempestīvĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. intempestivus <sense id="n24130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
intempestivus: <entryFree id="n24131" type="main" key="intempesti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tempestīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">untimely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unseasonable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inopportune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconvenient.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24131.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">postes intempestivos excisos credo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:873" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 873</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:929" default="NO" valid="yes">929</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1101" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitia numquam intempestiva est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:689" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 689</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intempestivā turbantes festa Minervā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>by their unseasonable spinning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immodica et intempestiva libido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:68:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 68, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid hoc joco intempestivius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:8:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gula,</quote> <trans><tr>gratified at unseasonable times</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intempestivo partu extracto,</quote> <trans><tr>premature</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 2, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24131.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that acts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">does a thing unseasonably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anseres continuo clamore intempestivi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 87, § 363</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> in two forms. </sense><sense id="n24131.3" n="1" level="3"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">intempestīvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">out of season</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unseasonably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adire ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fovere vulnera mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:11:19" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 11, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:19:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 19, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24131.4" n="2" level="3"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">intempestīvīter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unseasonably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 20</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
intempestus: <entryFree id="n24132" type="main" key="intempestus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intempestus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-tempus</etym>,<cb n="INTE" />  <sense id="n24132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unseasonable.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24132.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">intempesta nox,</quote> <trans><tr>the dead of night</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:587" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 587</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:247 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 247 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:7:section=72" default="NO">7, § 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox intempesta, quae non habet idoneum tempus rebus gerendis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 3, p. 209</bibl></cit> Bip.—Hence, personified: <cit><quote lang="la">intempesta silet Nox,</quote> <trans><tr>dismal Night</tr>, <tr>the mother of the Furies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:846" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 846</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24132.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24132.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unwholesome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unhealthy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graviscae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 184</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24132.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Stormy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tempestuous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tonans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:153" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 153</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intemporalis: <entryFree id="n24133" type="main" key="intempo^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tempŏrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n24133.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Without time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eternal</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 23, 1</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 10, 316. — </sense><sense id="n24133.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Untimely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unseasonable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:10" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 10</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">intempŏrālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unseasonably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti cataplasmatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:9:50" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 9, 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intemporalitas: <entryFree id="n24134" type="main" key="intempo^ra_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intempŏrālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>intemporalis</etym>, <sense id="n24134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unseasonableness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">somni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:9:64" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 9, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 1:15:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15, 120</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intenditus: <entryFree id="n24135" type="main" key="intendi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intendĭtus</orth>, v. intendo <sense id="n24135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
intendo: <entryFree id="n24136" type="main" key="intendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tendo</orth>, <itype>di, tum and sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (<sense id="n24136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part.</hi> intenditus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Fer. Als. 3:11" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Fer. Als. 3, 11</bibl> Mai.), <hi rend="ital">to stretch out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24136.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24136.2" n="A" level="2"> In hunc intende digitum, hic lenost, <hi rend="ital">point</hi> in scorn, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextram ad statuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:107" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubet intendi bracchia velis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:829" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 829</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intenta bracchia remis, id. ib, 5, 136: ventis vela,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 683</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervos aut remittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 10, 62, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 35, 53, § 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamque manus Colchis crinemque intenderat astris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:68" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 68</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24136.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bend</hi> a bow, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ballistam in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:704" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 704</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intentus est arcus in me unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 7, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24136.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To aim</hi> or <hi rend="ital">direct</hi> at a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">tela in patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela intenta jugulis civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:590" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 590</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum in jugulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24136.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To stretch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spread out; to stretch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay</hi> or <hi rend="ital">put upon</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">tabernacula carbaseis intenta velis,</quote> <trans><tr>pitched</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:12:section=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 12, § 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 31, § 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sella intenta loris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stuppea vincula collo Intendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duro intendere bracchia tergo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to bind with the cestus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum sertis,</quote> <trans><tr>encircled</tr>, <tr>surrounded</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 506</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vela secundi Intendunt Zephyri,</quote> <trans><tr>swell</tr>, <tr>fill</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intendentibus tenebris,</quote> <trans><tr>spreading</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24136.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24136.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To strain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stretch towards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to extend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem acrem in omnes partes intendit,</quote> <trans><tr>turns keen looks on every side</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:18:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 18, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem longius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 25, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo intendisset oculos,</quote> <trans><tr>whithersoever he turns his eyes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures ad verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:4:36" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 4, 36</bibl></cit>: cum putaret licere senatui, et mitigare leges et intendere, <hi rend="ital">to stretch</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">increase the rigor of</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 9, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numeros intendere nervis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:776" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 776</bibl></cit> (per nervos intentos, Forbig.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">strepitum fidis intendisse Latinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:4" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24136.8" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n24136.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To direct</hi> towards any thing, <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bend</hi> in any direction: <cit><quote lang="la">digna est res ubi tu nervos intendas tuos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intendenda in senem est fallacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eo quo intendit, cum exercitu mature perveniat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 9</bibl></cit>: iter, <hi rend="ital">to direct one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s course</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad explorandum quonam hostes iter intendissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:33:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 33, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a porta ad praetorem iter intendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coeptum iter in Italiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 29, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:46:9" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 46, 9</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo nunc primum intendam,</quote> <trans><tr>whither shall I turn?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24136.10" n="2" level="3"> Intendere animum, <hi rend="ital">to direct one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s thoughts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attention to</hi> any thing: quaero enim non quibus intendam rebus animum, sed, etc., Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 329, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parum defigunt animos et intendunt in ea, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 15, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo animum intendat, facile perspicio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Liv. praef. 9: intentus animus tuus est ad fortissimum virum liberandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi mentesque ad pugnam intentae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ea re omnium nostrorum intentis animis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intendere animum in regnum Adherbalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad bellum animum intendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 43:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 43, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum studiis et rebus honestis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">considerationem in aliquam rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes cogitationes ad aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium eo curae sunt intentae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad scribendum animum, oculos, manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 7</bibl></cit>: ubi ingenium intenderis, <cb n="INTE" /> valet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 51:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 51, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eruditionem tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 14</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24136.11" n="3" level="3"> Hence, intendere alone, <hi rend="ital">to urge on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intenderant eum ad cavendi omnia curam tot auditae proditiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad custodiae curam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis omnis intendenda rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24136.12" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To enlarge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magnify</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intendetur socordia, si nullus ex se metus aut spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amici accendendis offensionibus callidi, intendere vera. adgerere falsa,</quote> <trans><tr>exaggerated</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 57</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 11: gloriam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 26</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 35: tormentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 15 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n24136.13" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">to turn one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s attention to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exert one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to purpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endeavor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pergin, sceleste, intendere hanc arguere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 27</bibl></cit> Brix: <cit><quote lang="la">quod est tibi ante explicandum, quam illuc proficiscare, quo te dicis intendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ubi secus procedit, neque quod intenderat, efficere potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 25:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 25, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quocumque intenderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 74:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 74, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 64:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 64, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">102, 1: genera lectionum, quae praecipue convenire intendentibus, ut oratores fiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad nuptias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24136.14" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo ire intenderant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 107:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 107, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altum petere intendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24136.15" n="D" level="2"> Intendere se, <hi rend="ital">to exert one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prepare for</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad firmitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: qui se intenderunt adversarios in ejus tribunatum, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 4, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24136.16" n="E" level="2"> Intendere animo, <hi rend="ital">to purpose in one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to intend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si C. Antonius, quod animo intenderat, perficere potuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24136.17" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To maintain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assert</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam sese intendit esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 19</bibl></cit>.—Esp., as leg. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to aver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maintain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assert</hi> as a plaintiff in court: <cit><quote lang="la">quo modo nunc intendit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 29, 88</bibl></cit>: si quod intendit adversarius tuus, probationibus implere non possit, Vet. cujusd. Jurec. Consult. 6, 16 Huschke; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:4:9:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 4, 9, § 6</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n24136.18" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To threaten with</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">to seek to bring upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to afflict with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui actionem perduellionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui litem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum in omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriarum formulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probra et minas alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metum intendere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 28</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24136.19" n="H" level="1"> Intendere in se, <hi rend="ital">to contemplate one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>: quid sit Deus: totus in se intendat, an ad nos aliquando respiciat, Sen. Q. N. praef. 1.— </sense><sense id="n24136.20" n="I" level="1"> Intendere alicui, <hi rend="ital">to be intended for</hi> a person, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3 praef" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3 praef.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n24136.21" n="K" level="1"> In rhet., <hi rend="ital">to premise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to state as the proposition of a syllogism</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 10</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24136.22" n="L" level="1"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">to make long</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to use</hi> (a syllable) <hi rend="ital">as long</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">primam syllabam intendit, tertiam corripuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:22" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 22</bibl></cit>. 18. — <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> in two forms. </sense><sense id="n24136.23" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">inten-tus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. </sense><sense id="n24136.24" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">On the stretch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:10:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 10, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 8, 8, § 26</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24136.25" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Attentive to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intent upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">waiting for</hi> something. </sense><sense id="n24136.26" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem pueri intenti ludo exercent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 380</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intentus recipiendo exercitui esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:42:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 42, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24136.27" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquo negotio intentus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 4</bibl>; 54.— </sense><sense id="n24136.28" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">eager</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at Romani domi militiaeque intenti festinare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus nihil sane intentus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intenti exspectant signum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intenti ora tenebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totam causam quam maxime intentis, quod aiunt, oculis contemplari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intentaque tuis precibus se praebuit aure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:132" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 132</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intentiore custodia aliquem asservare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 19</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum intentissima conquisitione ad triginta milia peditum confecisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intentissima cura aliquid consequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:111" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec omnia intentissima cura acta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 22, 4</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24136.29" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Strict</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intentum et magnis delictis inexorabilem scias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intentius delectum habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intentiorem fore disciplinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 42</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24136.30" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Raised</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intento alimentorum pretio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 89</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24136.31" n="F" level="1"> Of speech and style, <hi rend="ital">vigorous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nervous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:60:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 60, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars orationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 52, 211</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tentē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with earnestness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attentively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pronuntiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 13</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> (cf. intense): <cit><quote lang="la">cum delectus intentius haberetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et quo intentius custodiae serventur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:30:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 30, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparare proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se excusare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">premere obsessos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adesse alicui rei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 11</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectans intentissime,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 14</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24136.32" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">intensus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. </sense><sense id="n24136.33" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Stretched,</hi> <pb n="976" /> <cb n="INTE" /> <hi rend="ital">tightened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tight</hi>: per intensos funes ire, Sen. de Ira, 2, 13.—</sense><sense id="n24136.34" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Violent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intensior impetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:35" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus in mediocribus modice intensior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nazar.</author> Pan. ad Const. 23, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24136.35" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Attentive; sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 56 al" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 56 al.</bibl>— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">intensē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">violently; comp.</hi>: intensius, Fronto de Fer. Als. 3 Mai.; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:15" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 15</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intensissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Mor. Eccl. 19" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Mor. Eccl. 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intenibilis: <entryFree id="n24137" type="main" key="inte^ni^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕnĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-teneo</etym>, <sense id="n24137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not to be grasped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intangible</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Aug. c. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fortun.</author> 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intensio: <entryFree id="n24138" type="main" key="intensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>intendo</etym>. <sense id="n24138.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A stretching out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">straining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effort</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 255" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 255</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24138.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An intensifying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calorem suum (sol) intensionibus ac remissionibus temperando fovet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:1:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24138.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The tune</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravis, media, acuta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intentabilis: <entryFree id="n24139" type="gloss" key="intenta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intentābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-tento</etym>, <sense id="n24139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be tried</hi>: intentabilis, <foreign lang="greek">a)pei/rastos,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
intentalis: <entryFree id="n24140" type="gloss" key="intenta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intentālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be tried</hi>: intentalis, <foreign lang="greek">a)pei/rastos,</foreign> Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
intentatio: <entryFree id="n24141" type="main" key="intenta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intentātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>intento</etym>, <sense id="n24141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stretching out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">extending towards</hi> a thing. </sense><sense id="n24141.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi ad intentationem subitam digitorum comprimuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24141.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a reproaching</hi> with a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">criminum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 46</bibl></cit> dub. (al. intentio).</sense></entryFree>
intentator: <entryFree id="n24142" type="main" key="intenta_to^r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tentātŏr</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n24142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who does not tempt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus malorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Jacob. 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Pecc. Mer. 2:4" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Pecc. Mer. 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intentatus: <entryFree id="n24143" type="main" key="intenta_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intentātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from intento.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24144" type="main" key="intenta_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tentātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">untouched.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24144.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacca intentata jugo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 62" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 62</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24144.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">untried</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unattempted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miseri, quibus Intentata nites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil intentatum nostri liquere poëtae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sors rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intente: <entryFree id="n24145" type="main" key="intente_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intentē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. intendo <sense id="n24145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
intentio: <entryFree id="n24146" type="main" key="intenti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intentĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>intendo</etym>, <sense id="n24146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stretching out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">straining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tension.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24146.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:10:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 10, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 14, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:16:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intentionem aëris ostendent tibi inflata, ... quid enim est vox nisi intentio aëris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:6:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et remissio motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 34</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24146.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Increase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">augmentation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">doloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 78:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 78, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ve particula tum intentionem significat, tum minutionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:5:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 5, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24146.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a directing of the mind towards</hi> any thing. </sense><sense id="n24146.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Exertion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effort</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus intentione sua depellit pressum omnem ponderum, opp. remissio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:23:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 23, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 27, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitationum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:14:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 14, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum curae intentionisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut libertatem revoces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 78 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad intentiones capiendas habiliores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:2:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24146.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Attention</hi>, <hi rend="ital">application</hi> to any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">lusūs,</quote> <trans><tr>to play</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intentionem alicui accommodare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 113:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 113, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avocare ab intentione operis destinati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei familiaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24146.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A design</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intention</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec intentio tua ut libertatem revoces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:78" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defuncti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:1:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> de Jos. Patriarch. 11, 52</bibl>; Aug. c. Mendac. 18.— </sense><sense id="n24146.7" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A charge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accusation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intentio adversariorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:43:125" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 43, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judiciale genus officiis constat duobus, intentionis ac depulsionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:9:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 9, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:9" default="NO">7, 1, 9</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n24146.8" n="2" level="3"> Esp., law t. t., <hi rend="ital">that part of the</hi> formula or <hi rend="ital">instruction given by the prætor to the court</hi>, <hi rend="ital">setting forth the judgment</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relief prayed for by a plaintiff</hi> in his complaint (cf. Sanders, Inst. of Just. introd. p. 65 sqq.): <cit><quote lang="la">intentio est ea pars formulae qua actor desiderium suum concludit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:41" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:44" default="NO">44</bibl> sq.; <cit><quote lang="la">53 sq.: cum petitor intentionem suam perdiderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:4:9:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 4, 9, § 6</bibl></cit>: quod intentionis vestrae proprias afferre debeatis probationes, Vet. Consult. 6, 14 Huschke.— </sense><sense id="n24146.9" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The first</hi> or <hi rend="ital">major premise</hi> in a syllogism: <cit><quote lang="la">ita erit prima intentio, secunda assumptio, tertia conexio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intentiose: <entryFree id="n24147" type="main" key="intenti^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intentĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n24147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eagerly</hi>: emunt, Vet. Schol. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:15" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intentivus: <entryFree id="n24148" type="main" key="intenti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intentīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>intendo</etym>, <sense id="n24148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">intensive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adverbia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1022</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
intento: <entryFree id="n24149" type="main" key="intento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intento</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stretch out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">extend towards</hi> any thing. <cb n="INTE" /> </sense><sense id="n24149.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec sica intentata nobis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui manus, Auct. B. Hisp. 22: cum voces cum manus intentarent,</quote> <trans><tr>raise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strictos gladios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus ad sidera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 112</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24149.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24149.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To direct</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turn towards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos in proeliantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24149.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To stretch out threateningly towards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to threaten</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attack with</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor ardentes faces intentat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:27:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 27, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma Latinis Hernicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanum imperium intentantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesentemque viris intentant omnia mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Verginius intentans in Appium manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:47:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 47, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probra ac verbera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terror omnibus intentabatur,</quote> <trans><tr>all were struck with terror</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invicem crimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:10:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 5, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 2, 12</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24149.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accuse</hi> one: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi intentantis loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:43:125" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 43, 125</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intentus: <entryFree id="n24150" type="main" key="intentus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from intendo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24151" type="main" key="intentus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intentus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>intendo</etym>, <sense id="n24151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stretching out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extending</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:55:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 55, 117</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intepeo: <entryFree id="n24152" type="main" key="inte^pe^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tĕpĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be lukewarm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et lacus aestivis intepet Umber aquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 124: <cit><quote lang="la">Lernaea palus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:377" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 377</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intepesco: <entryFree id="n24153" type="main" key="inte^pesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tĕpesco</orth>, <itype>pŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n24153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become lukewarm.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24153.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quis intepescat cibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 78" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strata membris tuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10</bibl></cit>. 54: <cit><quote lang="la">intepescit annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitigato et intepescente calore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24153.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to become weaker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">milder; to cool down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lose force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slacken</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iramque meam prudenti absentia extinxit: paululum ergo intepescente saevitia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">30, 4, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alacritas pugnatorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 13, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of persons,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 20, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inter: <entryFree id="n24154" type="main" key="inter1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, and <pos>prep.</pos> with <case>acc.</case> [kindred to in, intra; Sanscr. antar; Goth. undar; Germ. unter; Engl. under]. <sense id="n24154.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the midst</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in between</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">dumque pii petit ora patris stetit arduus inter pontus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:337" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 337</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot montibus inter diviso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:220" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 220</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:382" default="NO">8, 382</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n24154.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Prep.</hi>, with <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">belwixt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">among</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surrounded by.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24154.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, in space. </sense><sense id="n24154.3" n="1" level="3"> Of position only. </sense><sense id="n24154.4" n="a" level="4"> Referring to two places or objects, <hi rend="ital">between</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (mons Jura) est inter Sequanos et Helvetios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum inter me et Brundisium Caesar esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter Padum atque Alpes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager Tarquiniorum, qui inter urbem ac Tiberim fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus inter duos lucos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Artemisium inter Euboeam continentemque terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">inter haec maria Asia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24154.5" n="b" level="4"> Referring to more than two places or objects, <hi rend="ital">among</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the midst of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter hostium tela versari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter multos saucios spe incertae vitae relictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex inter primos constiterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:3:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter multitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter lignarios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:41:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 41, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repertae inter spolia catenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicos aut inter vias manere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter ingentes solitudines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J 89:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J 89, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter deserta ferarum Lustra domosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:646" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 646</bibl></cit>.— So, even with a noun in the <number>sing.</number>, <hi rend="ital">in the midst of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surrounded by</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat inter ceteram planitiem mons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 92:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 92, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibicines inter exercitum positi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter caedem aquila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 60</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter ceteram praedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 16, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 10, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter purpuram atque aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:17:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 17, 16</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24154.6" n="2" level="3"> With verbs of motion. </sense><sense id="n24154.7" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">among</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter medias stationes hostium erupere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies inter bina castra procedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 18, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter oppositas classes transmisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatiabatur in nemore Parmenion medius inter duces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:2:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medios inter hostes Londinium perrexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 33</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24154.8" n="b" level="4"> Pregn., including motion to and position between or among things mentioned, <hi rend="ital">among</hi>, <hi rend="ital">into the midst of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter densas, umbrosa cacumina, fagos Adsidue veniebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te mea dextera magna inter praemia ducet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 437</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dico te priore nocte venisse inter falcarios in Laecae domum,</quote> <trans><tr>among the scythe-makers</tr>, <tr>into the street of the scythe-makers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24154.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of relations conceived as local. </sense><sense id="n24154.10" n="1" level="3"> In discrimination (doubt, <cb n="INTE" /> choice, etc.), <hi rend="ital">between</hi> two or more objects: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium inter deas tres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:50:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 50, 114</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter Marcellos et Claudios patricios judicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:39:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 39, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter has sententias dijudicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:11:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 11, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter diversas opiniones electio, Quint. prooem. 2: discrimen inter gratiosos cives atque fortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:21:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 21, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter optime valere et gravissime aegrotare nihil prorsus interesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:13:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 13, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui bellum et pacem inter dubitabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trepidare inter scelus metumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter pugnae fugaeque consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 27</bibl></cit>.—So, with inter repeated: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nihil inter te atque inter quadrupedem aliquam putes interesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:9:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 9, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid intersit inter popularem civem et inter constantem, severum et gravem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 25, 95</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24154.11" n="2" level="3"> In expressing any relation which connects two or more persons, conceived as <hi rend="ital">between</hi> or <hi rend="ital">among</hi> them (strife, rivalry, friendship, intercourse, etc.). </sense><sense id="n24154.12" n="(a)" level="5"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quos inter magna fuit contentio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Mil. 4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Mil. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nestor componere lites Inter Peliden festinat et inter Atriden,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamen inter primores civitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 6</bibl></cit>.—Esp., with <hi rend="ital">pronouns</hi>, to express all reciprocal relations, <hi rend="ital">among</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">between one another; mutually</hi>, <hi rend="ital">together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi nunc non norimus nos inter nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:28:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 28, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:26:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 26, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod colloquimur inter nos,</quote> <trans><tr>with one another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter nos naturā ad civilem communitatem conjuncti sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:20:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 20, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vobis inter vos voluntatem fuisse conjunctam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:11:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 11, 34</bibl></cit>: Ciceronis pueri amant inter se, <hi rend="ital">love one another</hi> (like the Fr. <hi rend="ital">s</hi>'<hi rend="ital">entr</hi>'<hi rend="ital">aimer</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se consultare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se amare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque solum se colent inter se ac diligent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:22:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 22, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Di inter se diligunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:44:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 44, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furtim inter se aspiciebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">complecti inter se lacrimantes milites coepisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec inter se cum repugnent, plerique non vident,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:29:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 29, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se nondum satis noti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio et oratio conciliat homines inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:16:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 16, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne nostra nobiscum aut inter nos cessatio vituperetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae res eos in magno diuturnoque bello inter se habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 79:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 79, 3</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes pleon., the reciprocal relation being sufficiently expressed by the context: <cit><quote lang="la">manus conserentis inter se Romanos exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:41:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 41, 19</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">Ulixes cum Ajace summa vi contendere inter se,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Dict. Cret.</author> 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conferti inter se,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24154.13" n="(b)" level="5"> So of things: <cit><quote lang="la">ita effici complexiones atomorum inter se,</quote> <trans><tr>mutual</tr>, <tr>reciprocal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles duos inter se propinquos occupat,</quote> <trans><tr>near one another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 98:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 98, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud procul inter se erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 41, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum inter se distant istae facultates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:49:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 49, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res inter se similes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se dissimilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24154.14" n="(g)" level="5"> Of a common privacy, secrecy, etc.: inter nos, <hi rend="ital">between</hi> or <hi rend="ital">among ourselves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confidentially</hi>, like the Fr. <hi rend="ital">entre nous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec consulto dicis occulte, sed quod inter nos liceat, ne tu quidem intellegis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:26:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 26, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod inter nos liceat dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod inter nos sit,</quote> <trans><tr>but let that be between ourselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 12:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 12, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24154.15" n="(d)" level="5"> With nouns denoting a multitude of persons, like apud (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">haudquaquam inter id genus contemptor habebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 34, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter hostes variae fuere sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credula fama inter gaudentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">more inter veteres recepto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 85</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24154.16" n="3" level="3"> Of a class of persons or things to which the subject is referred. </sense><sense id="n24154.17" n="a" level="4"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">among</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines inter suos nobiles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 22, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter suos et honestus et nobilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in oratoribus vero admirabile est, quantum inter omnes unus excellat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter philosophos (Xenophon) reddendus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille Croesus, inter reges opulentissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Borysthenes inter Scythiae amnes amoenissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.— So freq. with <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, inter and <case>acc.</case> take the place of a <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestissimus inter suos numerabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimum inter eos valere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximum imperium inter finitimos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter Atheniensīs longe clarissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 21, § 81</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 2:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:2:12" default="NO">2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:7:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:2:6" default="NO">36, 2, 6</bibl>. </sense><sense id="n24154.18" n="b" level="4"> Esp.: inter paucos, etc., <pb n="977" /> <cb n="INTE" /> <hi rend="ital">among few</hi>, i. e. among the few select ones, <hi rend="ital">eminently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">especially</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pingunt et vestes in Aegypto inter pauca mirabili genere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 42, § 150</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sternutamento utilis inter pauca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 11, 58, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna inter paucas memorata populi Romani clades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter paucos disertus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter paucos familiarium Neroni assumptus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claritudine paucos inter senum regum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 10</bibl></cit>;
