so, inter alios: judicatur inter alios omnes beatus, qui in proelio profuderit animam, <hi rend="ital">among all others to be noticed</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">especially</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the highest degree</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 2, 3, 6</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">inter cuncta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter cetera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24154.19" n="c" level="4"> In judic. lang., t. t.: inter sicarios, <hi rend="ital">on the charge of assassination</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum praetor quaestionem inter sicarios exercuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:16:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 16, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:53:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 53, 147</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in recuperatorio judicio ejus maleficii, de quo inter sicarios quaeritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:20:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 20, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longo intervallo judicium inter sicarios hoc primum committitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sexcenti sunt, qui inter sicarios et de veneficiis accusabant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 32, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ostenderis, quomodo sis eos inter sicarios defensurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24154.20" n="4" level="3"> In some idiomatic phrases. </sense><sense id="n24154.21" n="a" level="4"> Inter manus, <hi rend="ital">within reach</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">close at hand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante oculos interque manus sunt omnia vestras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 311</bibl></cit>; also, <hi rend="ital">upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in the hands</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter manus domum ablatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter quas (manus) collapsus extinguitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:2:39" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter manus auferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:11:section=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 11, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter manus meas crevit,</quote> <trans><tr>under my hands</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus inter maestorumque ora parentum,</quote> <trans><tr>before their faces and within their reach</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:681" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 681</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24154.22" n="b" level="4"> Inter viam, vias, <hi rend="ital">on the way</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum rus eo, coepi egomet mecum inter vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 3, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si se inter viam obtulerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24154.23" n="C" level="2"> Of time. </sense><sense id="n24154.24" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Between</hi> two dates or periods specified: <cit><quote lang="la">dies XLV. inter binos ludos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24154.25" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">During</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the course of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">within;</hi> for which, in English, we sometimes use <hi rend="ital">by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quot prandia inter continuum perdidi triennium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia agentur, quae inter decem annos nefarie flagitioseque facta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui inter annos tot unus inventus sit, quem, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 23, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter ipsum pugnae tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter noctem lux orta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui plus cernant oculis per noctem quam inter diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24154.26" n="c" level="4"> Freq., with <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi>, to denote an act performed at a certain time, <hi rend="ital">in the course of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">while</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec inter cenam Tironi dictavi,</quote> <trans><tr>at table</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. Fragm. 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illuseras heri inter scyphos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter fulmina et tonitrua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promptior inter tenebras affirmatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter initia,</quote> <trans><tr>at the beginning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 25</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24154.27" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">During</hi>, and hence under the circumstances described, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in spite of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notwithstanding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis inter has turbas senatus tamen frequens flagitavit triumphum,</quote> <trans><tr>amid</tr>, <tr>in spite of these commotions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrumque consilium aspernatus, quod inter ancipitia deterrimum est, dum media sequitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senum coloniae inter male parentes et injuste imperantes aegra municipia et discordantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ita neutris cura posteritatis inter infensos vel obnoxios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24154.28" n="e" level="4"> Inter haec, inter quae, <hi rend="ital">meanwhile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">during this time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">= interea, inter haec major alius terror,</quote> <trans><tr>in the mean time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter haec jam praemissi Albam erant equites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:57:7" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 57, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter quae tribuni plebei petivere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">58</bibl>; 3, 33; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter quae unctione uti licet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">So with gerunds and gerundives: inter agendum,</quote> <trans><tr>at</tr>, <tr>while</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter disceptandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:7:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter res agendas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 45</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24154.29" n="D" level="2"> In composition its final <hi rend="ital">r</hi> is assimilated in intellego and its derivatives. </sense><sense id="n24154.30" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Between;</hi> as, intercedere, interponere. — </sense><sense id="n24154.31" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">At intervals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from time to time;</hi> as, interaestuare, intermittere, intervisere.— </sense><sense id="n24154.32" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to the bottom;</hi> as, interire, interficere.</sense></entryFree>
interaestimatio: <entryFree id="n24155" type="hapax" key="inte^raesti^ma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕr-aestĭmātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n24155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">valuation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:64" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 64</bibl> dub. (al. in aestimationem).</sense></entryFree>
interaestuo: <entryFree id="n24156" type="main" key="inte^raestu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕr-aestŭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bubble up</hi> <cb n="INTE" /> <hi rend="ital">at intervals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be restless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachus frequenter interaestuans erat,</quote> <trans><tr>producing frequent eructations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:16:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 16, 19</bibl></cit>; Ambros. Hexaëm. 5, 11, 35.</sense></entryFree>
interamenta: <entryFree id="n24157" type="main" key="inte^ra_menta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕrāmenta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>inter</etym>, <sense id="n24157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">timber for the lower part and hold of a shipof-war</hi>, including the statumina and costæ: <cit><quote lang="la">Volaterrani interamenta navium polliciti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:45:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 45, 15</bibl></cit> Weissenb. (less correctly, acc. to others, <orth extent="full" lang="la">incērāmenta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">rosin and pitch for calking a ship</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
interamna: <entryFree id="n24158" type="main" key="Inte^ramna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Intĕramna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Intĕramnā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. interamnus, II.</entryFree>
interamnas: <entryFree id="n24159" type="main" key="Inte^ramnas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Intĕramnas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, v. interamnus, II. B. 1.</entryFree>
interamnus: <entryFree id="n24160" type="main" key="inte^ramnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕr-amnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>amnis</etym>, <sense id="n24160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is between two rivers</hi> (as an <pos>adj.</pos>, late Lat.): terras interamnas (al. interamnanas) recepimus (viz. <hi rend="ital">Mesopotamia</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus ad insulae faciem spatia amplectitur interamna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 32, 1</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n24160.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Intĕramna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. urbs). </sense><sense id="n24160.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The name of several Italian cities</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=28" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 28</bibl>.—Esp. </sense><sense id="n24160.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A city of Umbria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surrounded by the river Nar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of the historian Tacitus and of the emperor of the same name</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Terni</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:17:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 17, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:63:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 63, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24160.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Liris</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Teramo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:41:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 41, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 9, 3</bibl>. — Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Interamnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21:27" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 21, 27</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n24160.5" n="B" level="2"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n24160.6" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Interamnas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Interamna</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:39:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 39, 1</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Interam-nātes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">inhabitants of Interamna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 15, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Interamnates cognomine Nartes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:14:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 14, 19</bibl></cit> § 113.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Causinius Schola, Interamnas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:17:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 17, 46</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24160.7" n="2" level="3"> ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">Intĕramnānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Interamna</hi>, Inscr. ap. Don. 161, 3.—</sense><sense id="n24160.8" n="3" level="3"> ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">Intĕramnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">CIVITAS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3773</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interaneum: <entryFree id="n24161" type="main" key="inte^ra_ne^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕrānĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. interaneus, II.</entryFree>
interaneus: <entryFree id="n24162" type="main" key="inte^ra_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕrānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inter</etym>, <sense id="n24162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">internal.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24162.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vomica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 96" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 96</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24162.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕrānĕ-um</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a gut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intestine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">procedentis interanei morbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 9, 33, § 105</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 7, 20, § 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interaperio: <entryFree id="n24163" type="gloss" key="inte^ra^pe^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕr-ăpĕrĭo</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">dianoi/gw,</foreign> Gloss. Phil.</entryFree>
interaptus: <entryFree id="n24164" type="hapax" key="interaptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-aptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, i. q. interjunctus, <sense id="n24164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">joined together;</hi> in tmesi: <cit><quote lang="la">quae memorare queam inter singillariter apta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1067" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1067</bibl></cit>; v. Lachm. ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
interaresco: <entryFree id="n24165" type="main" key="inte^ra_resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕr-āresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n24165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dry up.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24165.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalia sine humoris potestate interarescent,</quote> <trans><tr>will die off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8 praef.</bibl></cit> § 3.—</sense><sense id="n24165.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to dry up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decay;</hi> with exstingui et cadere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:14:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 14, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interbibo: <entryFree id="n24166" type="main" key="interbi^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-bĭbo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drink in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drink up</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 22</bibl>: mare, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 5, 26</bibl> (Fragm. Trag. v. 55 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
interbito: <entryFree id="n24167" type="hapax" key="interbi_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-bīto</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>beto</etym>, i. q. intereo, <sense id="n24167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to perish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come to naught</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne interbitat quaestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interblandiens: <entryFree id="n24168" type="hapax" key="interblandi^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-blandĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [blandior], <sense id="n24168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flattering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsequiis meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 9:12" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 9, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intercaelestis: <entryFree id="n24169" type="main" key="intercaelestis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-caelestis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24169.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">between heaven and earth</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. An. 2, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intercalaris: <entryFree id="n24170" type="main" key="interca^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intercălāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>intercalo</etym>, <sense id="n24170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for insertion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that is to be</hi> or <hi rend="ital">is inserted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intercalary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <trans><tr>an intercalary day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 8, 6, § 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> de Die Nat. 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensis,</quote> <trans><tr>an intercalary month</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Censor. l. l.: Kalendae,</quote> <trans><tr>the first day of an intercalary month</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 25, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 11, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:44:3" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 44, 3</bibl>: Calendae priores, <hi rend="ital">the first day of the first intercalary month</hi> (of the two months that Cæsar intercalated), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 14, 2</bibl>; cf. the foll. art.—</sense><sense id="n24170.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: versus, <hi rend="ital">with a refrain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">burden</hi> (as in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8</bibl>: incipe Maenalios, etc.; and: <cit><quote lang="la">ducite ab urbe domum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ib. 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intercalarius: <entryFree id="n24171" type="main" key="interca^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intercălārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>intercalaris</etym>, <sense id="n24171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for insertion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intercalary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensis,</quote> <trans><tr>an intercalary month</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 19, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:59:2" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 59, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 40</bibl>; the same <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intercalarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:52:section=130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 52, § 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <trans><tr>leap-year</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 48, § 130</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:207" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 25, 57, § 207</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intercalatio: <entryFree id="n24172" type="main" key="interca^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intercălātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>intercalo</etym>, <sense id="n24172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an insertion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intercalation</hi> of a day or month, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 47, § 122</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intercalator: <entryFree id="n24173" type="hapax" key="interca^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intercălātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an intercalator;</hi><cb n="INTE" />  as <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">that intercalates</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies intercalatores,</quote> <trans><tr>intercalary days</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 14</bibl></cit> (al. intercalantes).</sense></entryFree>
intercalco: <entryFree id="n24174" type="main" key="intercalco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intercalco</orth>, v. interculco.</entryFree>
intercalo: <entryFree id="n24175" type="main" key="interca^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-călo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, lit., <sense id="n24175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to proclaim that something has been intercalated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to insert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intercalate</hi> a day or month (syn.: interpono, intericio); usu. in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si intercalatum erit Calendis Maiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut duodecim annis continuis non intercalaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasti intercalandi licentiā turbati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies intercalatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 14</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin. — Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando primo intercalatum sit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 13, 19</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Act. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Junius Servium Tullium regem primum intercalasse commemorat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 13, 20</bibl></cit>. The pontifices, to whom it was left to determine the number of intercalary days, were often induced, by party considerations, to insert more or fewer than the proper number of days, or even to neglect the intercalation altogether.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">pass. impers.</hi>: illud memento curare ... ut annus noster maneat suo statu, ne quid novi decernatur; <cit><quote lang="la">hoc tibi ita mando ... ut pugnes, ne intercaletur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24175.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">intercalata poena,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>put off</tr>, <tr>deferred</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intercapedinans: <entryFree id="n24176" type="main" key="interca^pe_di^nans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intercăpēdĭnans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype> <etym>intercapedo</etym>, <sense id="n24176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">interrupting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intermitting</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1, p. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intercapedinatus: <entryFree id="n24177" type="main" key="interca^pe_di^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intercăpēdĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">separated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interrupted</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 921</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exacerbationes (opp. continuae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intercapedo: <entryFree id="n24178" type="main" key="interca^pe_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-căpēdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>capio</etym>, <sense id="n24178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an interruption</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intermission</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interval</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respite</hi>: intercapedo, tempus interceptum, cum scilicet mora est ad capiendum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=111" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 111</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">intercapedinem scribendi facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molestiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurisdictionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with remissio, opp. continuatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—Of space (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">inter circulos universos quid interstitii vel spatii intercapedo naturalis immiserit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 837</bibl></cit>. —In <hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi> the word is said to have had an obscene signif., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intercapio: <entryFree id="n24179" type="main" key="interca^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-căpĭo</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take away</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 624</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
intercardinatus: <entryFree id="n24180" type="main" key="intercardi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-cardĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">joined together by mortise and tenon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mortised</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trabes (acc. to others, interordinatae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 20, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intercatia: <entryFree id="n24181" type="main" key="Intercati^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Intercatĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n24181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 48 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 6</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n24181.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Intercatĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from Intercatia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 1, 4, § 9</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Plur. absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Intercatienses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Intercatia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intercedo: <entryFree id="n24182" type="main" key="interce_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-cēdo</orth>, <itype>cessi, cessum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to intervene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be between</hi> (syn. intervenio). </sense><sense id="n24182.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24182.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis intercedat tertius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intercedente lunā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 11, 8, § 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palus intercedebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sylvae paludesque intercedebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter singulas legiones impedimentorum magnum numerum intercedere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 17, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24182.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n24182.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To occur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">happen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come to pass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe in bello parvis momentis magni casus intercedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter bellorum curas res parva intercessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum dictum intercessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24182.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24182.6" n="A" level="2"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">to intervene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix annus intercesserat, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intercessere pauci dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox nulla intercessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">una nox intercesserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24182.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exist</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">come between</hi> persons. </sense><sense id="n24182.8" n="1" level="3"> In order or rank: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi nemo intercedebat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:47:173" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 47, 173</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24182.9" n="2" level="3"> In feelings or conduct: <cit><quote lang="la">ira inter eas intercessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacebit dum intercedat familiaritas,</quote> <trans><tr>as long as our friendship lasts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 4, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter nosmetipsos vetus usus intercedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ei cum genere humano quasi civile jus intercederet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi intercederent mihi inimicitiae cum istius mulieris viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter nos officia paria intercedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:65:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 65, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic cum reliquis ... bella intercesserant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24182.10" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To interpose one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s credit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become surety for</hi> a person: <cit><quote lang="la">promisit, intercessit, dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2</bibl></cit>, <pb n="978" /> <cb n="INTE" /> 18, 45: <cit><quote lang="la">pro aliquo magnam pecuniam,</quote> <trans><tr>to procure for a person by becoming surety for him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omni genere negotiorum et obligationum ... intercedere mulieres prohibentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 11, 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24182.11" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To oppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withstand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protest against;</hi> of the tribunes of the people, who interposed their veto against a decree of the senate: <cit><quote lang="la">cum intercedere vellent rogationi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi mihi levissimus tribunus plebis intercessisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea lege, qua intercedi de provinciis non licebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea quae de reductione regis scripta est auctoritas, cui scis intercessum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuni plebis intercedentes pro se (Caesare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 30</bibl></cit>; cf. At. Cap. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:14:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 14, 6</bibl>. This right of protest was also possessed by other magistrates; v. Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 7</bibl>; Ascon. ap. Pis. 26; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 9</bibl>.—So fig.: <cit><quote lang="la">si status condictus cum hoste intercedit dies, tamen est eundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24182.12" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to interpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interfere.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24182.13" n="(a)" level="5"> For or in behalf of a person, <hi rend="ital">to intercede</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interpose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum enim vestra auctoritas intercessisset, ut ego regem tuerer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24182.14" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To obstruct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interrupt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nulla aegritudo huic gaudio intercesserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intercessit et, quominus in acta sua juraretur, ut ne mensis September Tiberius vocaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de cognomine intercessit Augustus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non quia intercedendum putem imaginibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parens noster privatas gratiarum actiones cohibet, intercessurus etiam publicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intercedere casibus, occursare fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 25</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniquitatibus magistratuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 80:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 80, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 1, 1, § 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interceptio: <entryFree id="n24183" type="main" key="intercepti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interceptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>intercipio</etym>, <sense id="n24183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a taking away</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">poculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:60:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 60, 167</bibl></cit>; Hilar. in Psa. 51, 18; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Gal. 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interceptor: <entryFree id="n24184" type="main" key="interceptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interceptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an intercepter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usurper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embezzler</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:50:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 50, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litis alienae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:72:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 72, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donativi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divini beneficii,</quote> <trans><tr>one who renders void</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:11:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 11, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interceptus: <entryFree id="n24185" type="main" key="interceptus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interceptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. intercipio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24186" type="main" key="interceptus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interceptus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>intercipio</etym>, <sense id="n24186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a taking away</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intercessio: <entryFree id="n24187" type="main" key="intercessi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intercessĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>intercedo</etym>, <sense id="n24187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a coming between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intervention.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24187.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">testium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24187.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24187.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An interposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a becoming surety</hi> for one: <cit><quote lang="la">mea intercessio parata et est et fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intercessiones pecuniarum in coitionibus candidatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 6, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24187.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A fulfilment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">performance</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 22, 1</bibl>; Cod. Th. 6, 28, 4. — </sense><sense id="n24187.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An intervention</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protest</hi> on the part of a tribune of the people, who annulled a decree of the Senate by his veto: <cit><quote lang="la">cum intercessio stultitiam intercessoris significatura sit, non rem impeditura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intercessionem liberam relinquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intercessionem facere pro aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intercessionem suam interponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intercessor: <entryFree id="n24188" type="main" key="intercessor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intercessor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who intervenes.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24188.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mediator</hi> in money matters, <hi rend="ital">a surety</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam semper esses tribunus: intercessorem non quaereres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 27, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:38:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 38, 110</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem aliquam agere intercessore ac deprecatore aliquo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 60, p. 313, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intercessorem quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 300" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 300</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolo per intercessorem mutueris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 119" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 119 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit> — </sense><sense id="n24188.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A fulfiller</hi>, <hi rend="ital">performer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 42, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 17, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24188.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who interposes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enters a protest.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24188.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A protester;</hi> of a tribune of the people who makes use of his veto, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrariae legi intercessorem fore professus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Caesar) restitit, partim per intercess?*!res tribunos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 29</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24188.5" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a hinderer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preventer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei malae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 4</bibl></cit> and 19.</sense></entryFree>
intercessus: <entryFree id="n24189" type="main" key="intercessus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intercessus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an intervention;</hi> only in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24189.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem intercessu suo servare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:4:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> Gub. D. 1, p. 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24189.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">intercessu auctoritatis suae prohibere ne, etc., Imp. Diocl. et Const. inter Fragm. Jur. Antei. p. 75 Mai.: temporis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 5, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intercido: <entryFree id="n24190" type="main" key="interci_do1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-cīdo</orth>, <itype>īdi, īsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>caedo</etym>,<cb n="INTE" />  <sense id="n24190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut asunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut to pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pierce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut through.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24190.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">harundinetum,</quote> <trans><tr>to thin out by cutting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:32:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 32, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 65, § 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:19:49:2:section=177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 19, 49, 2, § 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olivas acuto calamo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus, interciso monte, in Nar defluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 15, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">an Isthmos intercidi possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:49" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammas ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 28, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontem,</quote> <trans><tr>to cut down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24190.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., of accounts, <hi rend="ital">to mutilate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">falsify</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">commentarios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 22, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes dominicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:3:1:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 3, 1, § 5</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24190.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mangle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mutilate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententias,</quote> <trans><tr>to pervert in reading</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:30:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 30, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux intercisa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:184" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugum mediocri valle a castris intercisum,</quote> <trans><tr>separated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:14" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 14</bibl></cit>: dies intercisi, <hi rend="ital">half-holidays</hi>: intercisi dies sunt, per quos mane et vesperi est nefas; <cit><quote lang="la">medio tempore, inter hostiam caesam et exta porrecta, fas: a quo quod fas tum intercedit: aut eo est intercisum nefas, intercisum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=31" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 31</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:49" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 49</bibl>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">intercīsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">piecemeal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interruptedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confusedly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:2:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictum,</quote> <trans><tr>syncopated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24191" type="main" key="interci^do2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-cĭdo</orth>, <itype>ĭdi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>cado</etym>, <sense id="n24191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fall between.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24191.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita in arto stipatae erant naves ut vix ullum telum in mari vanum intercideret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 10, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24191.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24191.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To occur meanwhile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to happen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quae interciderunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 8, 3</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24191.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To fall to the ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go to ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be lost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perish</hi>: pereant amici, dum una inimici intercidant, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 9, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intercidunt ova,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 51, 74, § 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credo, quia nulla gesta res insignem fecerit consulatum, memoriā intercidisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum pejorem vocas, apud quem gratia beneficii intercidit, an apud quem etiam memoria?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">augur erat: nomen longis intercidit annis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:433" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 433</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive (opera) exstant, sive intercidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 8, 34, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec sequenti tempore interciderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum verba intercidant invalescantque temporibus,</quote> <trans><tr>fall into disuse</tr>, <tr>become obsolete</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si interciderit tibi nunc aliquid (= excidit e memoria),</quote> <trans><tr>something escapes you</tr>, <tr>you have forgotten something</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intercidona: <entryFree id="n24192" type="main" key="Interci_do_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Intercīdōna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. intercīdo</etym>, <sense id="n24192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the three deities</hi> (Intercidona, Pilumnus, and Deverra) <hi rend="ital">who protected the house of a lying-in woman against Silvanus</hi>, Varr. ap. Aug. Civ. Dei, 6, 9; cf. Voss. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intercilium: <entryFree id="n24193" type="gloss" key="interci^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-cĭlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n24193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the space between the eyebrows</hi>: intercilium, <foreign lang="greek">meso/fruon,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 11, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intercino: <entryFree id="n24194" type="hapax" key="interci^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-cĭno</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cano</etym>, <sense id="n24194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sing between</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neu quid medios intercinat actus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 194</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intercipio: <entryFree id="n24195" type="main" key="interci^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-cĭpĭo</orth>, <itype>cēpi, ceptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>capio</etym>, lit., to take away between, i. e. <sense id="n24195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to seize on the passage before arrival at the destined place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to intercept.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24195.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tun redimes me, si me hostes interceperint?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum,</quote> <trans><tr>to take the poison intended for another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae interceptae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 8</bibl>; Cassiod. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:10:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 10, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:9:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum numerum jumentorum atque hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commeatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquis ab suis interceptus,</quote> <trans><tr>cut off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes discretos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 75</bibl></cit>: in sublime jactari sagoque intercipi (<hi rend="ital">be held fast</hi>) ne tellurem attingat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 3, 12, § 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">interceptae e publico pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terga caput tangunt, colla intercepta videntur,</quote> <trans><tr>to be wanting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 379</bibl></cit>: quam (hastam) medius Rhoeteus intercipit, <hi rend="ital">comes in the way of</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">is struck</hi> or <hi rend="ital">killed by</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 402</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24195.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24195.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To interrupt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preoccupy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preclude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medium iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 39, 2</bibl></cit> (al. intersaepto): <cit><quote lang="la">opportuna loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:43:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 43, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostiles ingressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medios sermones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedestre iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usum aurium intercipiente fremitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 13, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24195.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To take away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rob</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:7:25" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 7, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:75" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veram laudem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commentarios, quorum tamen pars maxima intercepta dicitur,</quote> <trans><tr>copied from other sources</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24195.5" n="C" level="2"> Of death, <cb n="INTE" /> <hi rend="ital">to snatch away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si me fata intercepissent, Quint. prooem. 1, 6: apes saepe morbis intercipiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex mortalitate interceptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 25, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">interceptus veneno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelere Pisonis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a manu gladiatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceterum interceptus quoque magnum sibi vindicat locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:121" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ob aliud interceptus, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Theophilum atrox interceperat casus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 7, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intercise: <entryFree id="n24196" type="main" key="interci_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intercīsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. intercīdo <sense id="n24196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
intercisimen: <entryFree id="n24197" type="gloss" key="interci_si_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intercīsīmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. intercīdo</etym>, <sense id="n24197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutting through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intersection</hi>: intercisimen, <foreign lang="greek">diakoph/,</foreign> Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
intercisi: <entryFree id="n24198" type="main" key="interci_si^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intercīsĭ</orth>o, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutting through</hi>, Varr. ap. Aug. Civ. Dei, 6, 9.</sense></entryFree>
interclamo: <entryFree id="n24199" type="main" key="intercla_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-clāmo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24199.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cry out between</hi> or <hi rend="ital">among</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis interclamantibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 13, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intercludo: <entryFree id="n24200" type="main" key="interclu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-clūdo</orth>, <itype>ūsi, ūsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>claudo</etym>, <sense id="n24200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shut out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shut off.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24200.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24200.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">block up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shut off.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24200.3" n="1" level="3"> Of one's way, passage, entrance, retreat, etc.; constr. (syn. intersaepio). </sense><sense id="n24200.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. of thing</hi> and <hi rend="ital">dat. of person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hisce omnis aditus ad Sullam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:38:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 38, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi reditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:5:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: intercludit aditum veritati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Mendac. 11" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Mendac. 11</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Esp. freq. in milit. lang.: iter inimicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitum Romano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditum Romanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:22:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 22, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24200.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. of person</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">multitudinis fugam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 11, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24200.6" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">abl. of thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">his superatis aut reditu interclusis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 30, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni exitu interclusi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 44, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interclusus itinere Caesar,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 59, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 20, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7</bibl>: ne reditu intercluderentur, Auct. B. Alex. 20, 5; but with <hi rend="ital">abl. of manner</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">via inculta atque interclusa frondibus et virgultis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Byzantii totum Pontum aegre repulsum, et cervicibus interclusum suis, sustinerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24200.7" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">bene laudata virtus voluptatis aditus intercludat necesse est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:35:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 35, 118</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnīs vias seditionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut fugam intercludat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 11</bibl></cit>, D. 4: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illos aspera ponti Interclusit hiemps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervis objectis, ut viam intercluderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitum ad opem ferendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 13, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24200.8" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to shut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">commeatus hostibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:39:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 39, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 6, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob interclusos commeatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 5, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:6:14" default="NO">3, 6, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:8:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 8, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">consuli admiratio intercluserat vocem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24200.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi> one from any thing. </sense><sense id="n24200.10" n="1" level="3"> From a place. </sense><sense id="n24200.11" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, and <case>abl.</case> (so most usu.): <cit><quote lang="la">adversarios ab oppido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:43:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 43, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeium ab eo (Dyrrachio),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 41, 3</bibl></cit>: ipsum ab reliquo exercitu, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 1, 4</bibl>: so, <cit><quote lang="la">ab exercitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a praesidio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 59, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intercludi ab oppido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 27, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interclusi ab suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:70:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 70, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a patria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:42:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 42, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab acie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:41:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 41, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunos a plebe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 4, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.; Auct. B. Alex. 27, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:26" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 26</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n24200.12" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <case>abl.</case> alone (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">hostem Hibero intercludere, et frumento prohibere (cf. 2. infra),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:67:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 67, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24200.13" n="2" level="3"> From aid, supplies, relief, etc.; with <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">re frumentaria intercludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumento commeatuque Caesarem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 48, 2</bibl></cit>: commeatibus nostros. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 23, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:61:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 61, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 72, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille commeatu et reliquis copiis intercludendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem commeatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:19:11" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 19, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes commeatibus in urbe inclusos intercludunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne tot fortissimos viros interclusos opprimeret hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:39:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 39, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">interclusi equites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § 2.—</sense><sense id="n24200.14" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To shut in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blockade</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">metuo, ne jam intercludemur, ut cum velitis exire, non liceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatem suis praesidiis interclusam tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:28:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 28, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veriti, ne angustiis intercluderentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in insidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:29:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 29, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam,</quote> <trans><tr>to stop the breath</tr>, <tr>to stifle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amazoniā latus peltā,</quote> <trans><tr>to cover</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:131" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 131</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24200.15" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevent;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">quominus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intercludor dolore, quominus ad te plura scribam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 8, 2</bibl></cit>. <pb n="979" /> <cb n="INTE" /></sense></entryFree>
