interclusio: <entryFree id="n24201" type="main" key="interclu_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interclūsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>intercludo</etym>, <sense id="n24201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stopping</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shutting up.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24201.1" n="I" level="1"> Animae, <hi rend="ital">a want of breath</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:46:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 46, 179</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24201.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A parenthesis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interclusus: <entryFree id="n24202" type="main" key="interclu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interclūsus</orth>, <mood>Part.</mood> of intercludo.</entryFree>
intercolumnium: <entryFree id="n24203" type="main" key="interco^lumni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-cŏlumnĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>columna</etym>, <sense id="n24203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the space between two columns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intercolumniation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambulationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa omnibus intercolumniis disposita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 7, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interconcilio: <entryFree id="n24204" type="main" key="interconci^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-concĭlĭo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to gain the favor of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conciliate</hi> a person, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 59</bibl> dub. (al. conciliandi).</sense></entryFree>
intercreatus: <entryFree id="n24205" type="main" key="intercre^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-crĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inwardly created</hi> or <hi rend="ital">produced</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interculco: <entryFree id="n24206" type="main" key="interculco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-culco</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>calco</etym>, <sense id="n24206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tread between</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita distantes ut interculcari possint vinacea (al. intercalcari),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:43:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 43, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intercultus: <entryFree id="n24207" type="main" key="intercultus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-cultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cultivated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tilled between</hi>: fines, Sic. Fl. Cond. Agr. p. 7.</sense></entryFree>
intercurro: <entryFree id="n24208" type="main" key="intercurro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-curro</orth>, <itype>curri, rsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n24208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> (tmesis in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1374</bibl>: inter plaga currere). </sense><sense id="n24208.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to run between.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24208.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24208.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">latitudine intercurrentis freti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 100</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24208.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to hasten in the meantime</hi> anywhere: <cit><quote lang="la">indicto delectu in diem certam, ipse interim Veios intercurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 19, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24208.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24208.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To run along with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mingle with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be among</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intercurrit quaedam distantia formis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:373" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 373</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his laboriosis exercitationibus dolor intercurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:15:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 15, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterum genus intercurrit nonnumquam, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma candida intercurrentibus sanguineis venis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 59, § 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibusdam intercurrit umbra,</quote> <trans><tr>a dark vein</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 5, 18, § 67</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24208.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To step between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to intercede</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnatur acerrime: qui intercurrerent, misimus tres principes civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 6, 17</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24208.8" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to run through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">traverse</hi> (late Lat.; <cit><quote lang="la">for percurrebat is the true reading,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 2, 12</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">intercurso spatio maris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 10, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intercurso: <entryFree id="n24209" type="main" key="intercurso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-curso</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n24209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n. freq.</hi> [intercurro] (tmesis: <cit><quote lang="la">inter enim cursant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 262</bibl></cit>), <hi rend="ital">to run between.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24209.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">intercursantibus barbaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 35, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24209.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lie between; to grow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">move</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">be in motion between</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acinos foliis intercursantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:88" default="NO" valid="yes">15, 22, 24, § 88</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in tmesi: inter enim cursant primordia principiorum motibus inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 262</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intercursus: <entryFree id="n24210" type="main" key="intercursus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intercursus</orth>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from intercurro; v. intercurro, II.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24211" type="main" key="intercursus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intercursus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>intercurro</etym>, only <sense id="n24211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a running between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intervention</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interposition</hi> (rare, except in Liv.): <cit><quote lang="la">periculum intercursu tum primum pubescentis filii propulsatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:46:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 46, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impeditus intercursu suorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:42:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 42, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulum intercursu rixa sedata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 29, 4</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of flashes of lightning: nox terribilis intercursu luminis diri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:27:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 27, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intercus: <entryFree id="n24212" type="main" key="intercus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-cus</orth>, <itype>cŭtis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cutis</etym>, <sense id="n24212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">under the skin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intercutaneous.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24212.1" n="I" level="1"> Esp., as med. t. t.: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua intercus,</quote> <trans><tr>the dropsy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentum alicui dare ad aquam intercutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:24:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 24, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus aquae intercutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:5 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 5 al.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n24212.2" n="B" level="2"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">intercus</orth>, <itype>cŭtis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the dropsy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumens morbi intercutis (al. aquae intercutis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Vita Hilar. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leucophlegmatiam, quam Latino nomine intercutem dicimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:8:102" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 8, 102</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24212.3" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: aquam te habere in animo intercutem, <hi rend="ital">dropsy in the mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a weak and watery mind</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 37, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24212.4" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">within the skin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">internal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inward</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intercutibus vitiis madentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. stupra, Cato ap. Prisc.p. 719 P.</sense></entryFree>
intercussus: <entryFree id="n24213" type="main" key="intercussus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intercussus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>inter-quatio</etym>, <sense id="n24213.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a striking between</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luminis,</quote> <trans><tr>a flashing between</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intercutitus: <entryFree id="n24214" type="gloss" key="intercu^ti_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intercŭtītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>intercus</etym>, <sense id="n24214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">greatly abused</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishonored</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=113" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 113</bibl> Müll.; v. fullo.</sense></entryFree>
interdianus: <entryFree id="n24215" type="main" key="interdi^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interdĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>interdiu</etym>, <sense id="n24215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">throughout the day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daily</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">cibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:7:95" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 7, 95</bibl></cit> (dub.).</sense></entryFree>
interdiarius: <entryFree id="n24216" type="gloss" key="interdi^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interdĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thief who</hi> <cb n="INTE" /> <hi rend="ital">steals by day</hi>: interdiarius, <foreign lang="greek">h(merokle/pths,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
interdico: <entryFree id="n24217" type="main" key="interdi_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-dīco</orth>, <itype>dixi, ctum</itype> (interdixem for interdixissem, Cat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to speak between</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to interpose by speaking.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24217.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24217.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To say among other things</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to remark meanwhile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interpose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in praesentiarum hoc interdicere non alienum fuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n24217.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To forbid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prohibit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interdict.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24217.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interdico, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interdicit atque imperat Cassivellauno ne Mandubratio noceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipit atque interdicit omnes unum peterent Indutiomarum, neu quis, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 58</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">ut ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim est interdictum ... ut singulis hominibus ne amplius quam singulas artes nosse liceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:50:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 50, 215</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:13:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 13, 30</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24217.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Alicui aliquid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">feminis dumtaxat purpurae usum (al. usu),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">histrionibus scaenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei convictum hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feminis convivia et conspectum virorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 41, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui admirationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interdictum est mare Antiati populo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religio civibus interdicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interdicitur vini potus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 10, 27, § 87</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbe interdicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 10, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24217.6" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Alicui</hi> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui arte sua uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:43" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sibi interdixerit habere, interdixit et poscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 18:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 18, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. with <hi rend="ital">ellips. of dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interdixit hariolus ... aliquid novi negoti incipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pari severitate interdixit commeatus peti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24217.7" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Alicui aliquā re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos interdicitis patribus commercio plebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā arrogantiā usus Ariovistus omni Galliā Romanis interdixisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:46:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 46, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meretriciis amoribus juventuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:20:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 20, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male rem gerentibus patribus bonis interdici solet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei domo suā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:66" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 66</bibl> (cf. 1. B. 2. infra.).—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">Aliquem aliquā re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem sacrificiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 13, 6</bibl></cit>; mostly in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod moribus eorum interdici non poterat socero gener,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,022:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ham. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophi urbe et Italiā interdicti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:11:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: illi omni jure interdicti, Q. Metell. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 7</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <case>dat.</case> and <hi rend="ital">de</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: interdixi tibi de medicis, <hi rend="ital">forbid to have to do with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warn against</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 7, § 14</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">abl. manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam senatus consulto interdiceretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24217.8" n="2" level="3"> In partic.: interdicere alicui aquā et igni, <hi rend="ital">to forbid one the use of fire and water</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to banish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanquam si illi aquā et igni interdictum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">futurum puto, ut aquā et igni nobis interdicatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus cum aquā et igni interdixisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 26, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 29, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24217.9" n="(b)" level="5"> Interdicere alicui (sc. aquā et igni), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1206,001:42" default="NO"><author>Ampel.</author> 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24217.10" n="(g)" level="5"> Interdicere alicui aquam et ignem, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 5, 27, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24217.11" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24217.12" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To enjoin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">command</hi> (of an injunction implying also a prohibition): <cit><quote lang="la">te familiae valde interdicere ut uni dicto audiens esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:39:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 39, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24217.13" n="B" level="2"> Of the prætor, <hi rend="ital">to forbid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interdict;</hi> esp., <hi rend="ital">to make a provisional</hi> or <hi rend="ital">interlocutory decree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetor interdixit de vi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetor qui de fossis, de cloacis, etc., interdicit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetor interdixit, ut unde dejectus esset, eo restitueretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 28, 80</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24217.14" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To make use of a prætor</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s interdict</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:71" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si adversus eum velis interdicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:18:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: alicui rem capitalem, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 178</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
interdictio: <entryFree id="n24218" type="main" key="interdicti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interdictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>interdico</etym>, <sense id="n24218.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prohibiting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interdicting</hi>: tecti et aquae et ignis interdictione, <hi rend="ital">banishment</hi>, Auct. Or. pro Dom. 30: <cit><quote lang="la">finium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habes igitur et theatri interdictionem de interdictione impudicitiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interdictor: <entryFree id="n24219" type="main" key="interdictor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interdictor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a forbidder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interdicter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">delicti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interdictorius: <entryFree id="n24220" type="main" key="interdicto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interdictōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>interdictor</etym>, <sense id="n24220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">prohibitory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interdictory</hi>, Salv. contr. Avar. 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi> p. 130 Rittersh.</sense></entryFree>
interdictum: <entryFree id="n24221" type="main" key="interdictum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interdictum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>interdico</etym>. <sense id="n24221.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a prohibition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequeone ego ted interdictis facere mansuetem meis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:21:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 21, 48</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24221.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., as a legal t. t., <hi rend="ital">a provisional decree</hi> of the prætor, esp. in disputes of private persons respecting possession, <hi rend="ital">prohibiting<cb n="INTE" />  some act</hi>, a prætorian <hi rend="ital">interdict</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">certis ex causis praetor aut proconsul auctoritatem suam finiendis controversiis interponit ... formulae verborum quibus in ea re utitur interdicta decretave vocantur: interdicta cum prohibet aliquid fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:139 sq" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 139 sq.</bibl></cit> (v. the context): <cit><quote lang="la">ergo hac lege jus civile, causae possessionum, praetorum interdicta tollentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">possessionem per interdictum repetere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interdicto contendere cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venire ad interdictum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 13</bibl></cit> and 83 (for the different classes of interdicts and their effects, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:142" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 142</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 4:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 4, 15</bibl> Sandars ad loc.).</sense></entryFree>
interdictus: <entryFree id="n24222" type="main" key="interdictus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interdictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from interdico.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24223" type="main" key="interdictus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interdictus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = interdictum, Jul. ap. Aug. contr. Sec. Resp. Jul. 6, 20.</entryFree>
interdidium: <entryFree id="n24224" type="main" key="Interdidi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Interdidĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n24224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place in Alexandria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Res Gest. Alex. M. 1:30" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Res Gest. Alex. M. 1, 30</bibl> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
interdigitalia: <entryFree id="n24225" type="main" key="interdi^gi^ta_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-dĭgĭtālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number> [digitus], <sense id="n24225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">excrescences</hi> (warts, etc.) <hi rend="ital">between the fingers</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 2, 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interdigitia: <entryFree id="n24226" type="main" key="interdi^gi^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interdĭgĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number> [id.], <sense id="n24226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">excrescences</hi> (warts, etc.) <hi rend="ital">between the fingers and toes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 34</bibl>: intedita (leg. interdigitia) <foreign lang="greek">mesoda/ktula,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
interdiu: <entryFree id="n24227" type="main" key="interdi^u"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interdĭu</orth> (ante-class. form interdius, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 10</bibl> Schneid.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 33</bibl>; Most. 2, 2, 14; Merc. 5, 2, 21), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>dies</etym>, <sense id="n24227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">during the day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the daytime</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by day</hi> (not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">canes interdiu clausos esse oportet, ut noctu acriores sint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 124</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. noctu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:69:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 69, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:67:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 67, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec nocte nec interdiu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interdiu, nocte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:32" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interdius: <entryFree id="n24228" type="main" key="interdi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interdĭus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, see the preced. art.</entryFree>
interdo: <entryFree id="n24229" type="main" key="interdo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-do</orth>, dăre. <sense id="n24229.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To give an interval</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to give at intervals</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec mora nec requies interdatur ulla fluendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 227</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24229.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To distribute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus interdatus (through the body),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:868" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 868</bibl></cit> (by Lachm. written as two words, inter datus). —</sense><sense id="n24229.2" n="II" level="1"> (In the archaic form interduo, duim.) <hi rend="ital">To give for</hi> a thing (in Plaut.): <cit><quote lang="la">nihil interduo,</quote> <trans><tr>I care nothing about it</tr>, <tr>it is of no con sequence to me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 36</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">floccum non interduim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 152</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interduatim: <entryFree id="n24230" type="gloss" key="interdu^a_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interdŭātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, an old form for interdum, <sense id="n24230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sometimes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now and then</hi>, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=111" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 111</bibl> Müll. (but the true reading is interdum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 29</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
interduca: <entryFree id="n24231" type="main" key="Interdu_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Inter-dūca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inter-duco</etym>, <sense id="n24231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an epithet of Juno</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 149</bibl> Grotius (Kopp, Iterduca); cf. domiduca.</sense></entryFree>
interductus: <entryFree id="n24232" type="hapax" key="interductus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-ductus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n24232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">interpunctuation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:68:228" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 68, 228</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interdum: <entryFree id="n24233" type="main" key="interdum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-dum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n24233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sometimes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occasionally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now and then</hi>, = nonnumquam: <cit><quote lang="la">interdum fio Juppiter, quando lubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interdum cursus est in oratione incitatior, interdum moderata ingressio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo-interdum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo-modo-interdum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24233.1" n="II" level="1"> I. q. per aliquod tempus, <hi rend="ital">for some time</hi> (post-Aug.): acribus custodiis domum et vias saepserat Livia; <cit><quote lang="la">laetique interdum nuntii vulgabantur, donec,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occulere interdum et terrae mandare parabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:30" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:490" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 490</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24233.2" n="III" level="1"> I. q. interea, interim, <hi rend="ital">meanwhile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the meantime</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">interdum cognito strepitu procurrit cubiculo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 226, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4</bibl>, p. 149, 14; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:8:16:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 8, 16, § 1</bibl>; Cod. Th. 4, 3, 1.</sense></entryFree>
interduo: <entryFree id="n24234" type="main" key="interdu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interdŭo</orth>, <itype>duim</itype>, v. interdo, II.</entryFree>
interea: <entryFree id="n24235" type="main" key="inte^re^a_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕr-ĕā</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <sense id="n24235.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Meanwhile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the meantime</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the interim</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">saepe interea mihi senex narrabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interea dies advenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:15:section=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 15, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum interea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 6, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec dum Romae geruntur, Quintius interea de agro detruditur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 6</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">loci</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus triginta natus annis sum, cum interea loci Numquam quicquam facinus feci pejus quam hodie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 16</bibl>; Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 488, 14</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 71 Rib.).— * </sense><sense id="n24235.1" n="B" level="2"> (For interdum.) <hi rend="ital">Sometimes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:395" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 395</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24235.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, like Engl. <hi rend="ital">meanwhile</hi> (approaching the sense of), <hi rend="ital">nevertheless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">however</hi> (but in class. prose always retaining a reference to time; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Krebs, Antibarb. p. 611 sq.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum interea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:30:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 30, 82</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tamen interea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:101:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 101, 7</bibl></cit>. <pb n="980" /> <cb n="INTE" /></sense></entryFree>
interemptibilis: <entryFree id="n24236" type="main" key="inte^rempti^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕremptĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>interimo</etym>, <sense id="n24236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be destroyed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">killed</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Christus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interemptio: <entryFree id="n24237" type="main" key="inte^rempti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕremptĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-emt-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">destruction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slaughter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Prax. 27</bibl>; Porc. Lat. Decl. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 10</bibl> (but a false reading for internecione, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 11, 30</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
interemptor: <entryFree id="n24238" type="main" key="inte^remptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕremptor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-emt-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who destroys</hi> or <hi rend="ital">kills</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a slayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murderer</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">fratris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:129:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 129, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 70:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 70, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interemptrix: <entryFree id="n24239" type="main" key="inte^remptrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕremptrix</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-emt-</orth>), <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>interemptor</etym>, <sense id="n24239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that destroys</hi> or <hi rend="ital">kills</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a murderess</hi> (eccl. Lat.). </sense><sense id="n24239.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 10, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24239.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interemptus: <entryFree id="n24240" type="main" key="inte^remptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕremptus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-emt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from interimo.</entryFree>
intereo: <entryFree id="n24241" type="main" key="inte^re^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕr-ĕo</orth>, <itype>ĭi, ĭtum</itype> (<sense id="n24241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> -īvi, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, 7</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">sync.</hi> -issent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:8:20 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 8, 20 al.</bibl>), <itype>4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>—Prop., <hi rend="ital">to go among</hi> several things, so as no longer to be perceived (class.). </sense><sense id="n24241.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut interit magnitudine maris stilla muriae,</quote> <trans><tr>becomes lost in it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:14:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 14, 45</bibl></cit>: saxa venis, <hi rend="ital">become lost among them</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mingle with them</hi>, Sever. Aetn. 450. — </sense><sense id="n24241.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to perish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go to ruin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">decay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to die</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non intellego, quomodo, calore exstincto, corpora intereant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia fato Interitura gravi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segetes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salus urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interit ira morā,</quote> <trans><tr>ceases</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 374</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">possessio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:2:44" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 2, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24241.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be ruined</hi>, mostly in <hi rend="ital">first pers. perf.</hi>: interii, <hi rend="ital">I am ruined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hei mihi disperii! ... interii, perii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus exitiis interii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interii! cur mihi id non dixti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui per virtutem peritat, non interit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 32</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕrĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, <hi rend="ital">perished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroyed</hi> (ante- and post-class.): multis utrinque interitis, Claud. Quadrig. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 869</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interequito: <entryFree id="n24242" type="main" key="inte^re^qui^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕr-ĕquĭto</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n24242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ride between</hi> (a favorite word with Livy). </sense><sense id="n24242.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13, 22</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24242.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intererro: <entryFree id="n24243" type="main" key="inte^rerro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕr-erro</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wander between</hi> or <hi rend="ital">among</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to come</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">be between</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">Deus locis omnibus intererrat, Minuc. Fel. Octav. 10: splendor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 6, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interest: <entryFree id="n24244" type="main" key="inte^rest"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕrest</orth>, etc., v. intersum.</entryFree>
interfacio: <entryFree id="n24245" type="spur" key="interfa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>false reading for in perficiendo</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 11, 8</bibl>.</entryFree>
interfaris: <entryFree id="n24246" type="main" key="interfa_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-fāris</orth>, v. interfor.</entryFree>
interfatio: <entryFree id="n24247" type="main" key="interfa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interfātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>interfor</etym>, <sense id="n24247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a speaking between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an interrupting in speaking</hi> (syn. interpellatio): <cit><quote lang="la">contra verba atque interfationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:37:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 37, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expositiones brevi interfatione distinguere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 50</bibl></cit> Spald. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
interfectibilis: <entryFree id="n24248" type="main" key="interfecti^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interfectĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>interficio</etym>, <sense id="n24248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deadly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruta viperarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 89</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interfectio: <entryFree id="n24249" type="main" key="interfecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interfectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a killing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murdering</hi> (rare): Trebonii, Brut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>: Clodii, Ascon. ap. Argum. Milon. p. 34, 16.</sense></entryFree>
interfectivus: <entryFree id="n24250" type="main" key="interfecti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interfectīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deadly</hi> (post-class.): morbus, Cael. Aur. praef. § 12.</sense></entryFree>
interfector: <entryFree id="n24251" type="main" key="interfector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interfector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murderer.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24251.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 27, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 14, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 40, 9</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n24251.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a destroyer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carn. Christ. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interfectorius: <entryFree id="n24252" type="main" key="interfecto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interfectōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>interfector</etym>, <sense id="n24252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deadly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murderous</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Lib. Arb. 3:25" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Lib. Arb. 3, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 7, 7</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">interfectōrĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a means of destruction</hi>, Ambros. de Elia et Jejun. 10, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">interfectōrĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">destructively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murderously</hi>, Aug. contr. Parm. 3, 2, 14.</sense></entryFree>
interfectrix: <entryFree id="n24253" type="main" key="interfectrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interfectrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>interfector</etym>, <sense id="n24253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a murderess</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">nepotis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 122" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 122</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24253.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">abstinentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:8:95" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 8, 95</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interfectus: <entryFree id="n24254" type="main" key="interfectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interfectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from interficio.</entryFree>
interfeminium: <entryFree id="n24255" type="main" key="interfe^mi^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interfĕmĭnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>inter-femen</etym>, <cb n="INTE" /> i. q. cunnus (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 296, 15</bibl> and 22.</entryFree>
interfemus: <entryFree id="n24256" type="gloss" key="interfe^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-fĕmus</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n24256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the space between the thighs</hi>: interfemus, <foreign lang="greek">mesomh/rion,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
interficio: <entryFree id="n24257" type="main" key="interfi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interfĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, fectum</itype> (archaic <sense id="n24257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interfiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:872" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 872</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interfieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 131</bibl></cit>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>inter-facio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to put between.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24257.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">terrae natura medicatas aquas interficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 100, 104, § 222</bibl></cit> (al. inficiat).—</sense><sense id="n24257.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n24257.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To consume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devour</hi>: piscium magnam atque altilium vim, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 330, 31 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n24257.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To destroy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring to naught</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">messes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 330</bibl></cit>: herbas, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 450, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">usum, fructum, victum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 160, 25</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24257.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To kill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murder</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. neco, occido, trucido): aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Cat. 18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Cat. 18, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:18:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 18, 7 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">feras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1249</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case> of <hi rend="ital">separation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cut off from</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem et vitā, et lumine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 37</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case> of <hi rend="ital">means</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anum siti fameque atque algu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 36</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24257.6" n="2" level="3"> Esp. with <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to commit suicide</hi>: se ipsum, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 12, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes desperatā salute se ipsi interficiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 37, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 18, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:11:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 11, 20</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 1, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> al.—* </sense><sense id="n24257.7" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To interrupt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 269</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interfio: <entryFree id="n24258" type="main" key="interfi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interfīo</orth>, <itype>fĭĕri</itype>, v. interficio <sense id="n24258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
interfluo: <entryFree id="n24259" type="main" key="interflu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-flŭo</orth>, <itype>fluxi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n24259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> (in tmesi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 227</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">to flow between</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quantum interfluit fretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:23:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 23, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angusto freto interfluente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 11, § 76</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fretum, quod Naupactum et Ratras interfluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen Visurgis Romanos interfluebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 9</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interfluens urbi Tiberinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:4:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:7:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 23, 4</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulae interfluuntur (supply mari), App. de Mundo, p. 69 (but interfuissent is the true reading,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 6, 16</bibl></cit>).</sense></entryFree>
interfluus: <entryFree id="n24260" type="main" key="interflu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-flŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>interfluo</etym>, <sense id="n24260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flowing between</hi> (rare and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">interfluo Euphrate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 26, 30, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Sept. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
interfodio: <entryFree id="n24261" type="main" key="interfo^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-fŏdĭo</orth>, <itype>fōdi, fossum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dig out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dig between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pierce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pupillas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:716" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 716</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 12, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interfor: <entryFree id="n24262" type="main" key="interfor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-for</orth>, <itype>fātus sum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n24262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> (interfari, interfatur, interfatus are the forms in common use), <hi rend="ital">to speak between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to interrupt in speaking</hi> (syn. interpello): <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam ille postulatum perageret, interfatur Appius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orsum eum dicere, Phaeneas interfatus,</quote> <trans><tr>interrupted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus sic interfata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 386</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem interfari nefas est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 23, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interfossus: <entryFree id="n24263" type="main" key="interfossus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interfossus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from interfodio.</entryFree>
interfrigesco: <entryFree id="n24264" type="main" key="interfri_gesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-frīgesco</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <sense id="n24264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow old</hi>, <hi rend="ital">die away</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">be dropped in the meanwhile</hi> (post-class.): res, Fragm. Jur. Civ. Antejustin. p. 45.</sense></entryFree>
interfringo: <entryFree id="n24265" type="main" key="interfringo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-fringo</orth>, <itype>frēgi, fractum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>frango</etym>, <sense id="n24265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to break to pieces</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">si quid ventus interfregerit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 18, 30, § 127</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interfugio: <entryFree id="n24266" type="hapax" key="interfu^gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-fŭgĭo</orth>, <itype>fŭgĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to flee between</hi> or <hi rend="ital">into;</hi> in tmesi: <cit><quote lang="la">inter enim fugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 332</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interfulgeo: <entryFree id="n24267" type="hapax" key="interfulge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-fulgĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shine</hi> or <hi rend="ital">glitter between</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum cumulo aliarum rerum interfulgens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 23, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interfundo: <entryFree id="n24268" type="main" key="interfundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-fundo</orth>, <itype>fūdi, fūsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>2. fundo</etym>, <sense id="n24268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pour between; pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flow between</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">pelagus interfunditur oras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 250</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-terfūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>: <cit><quote lang="la">interfusum mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 86</bibl></cit>: Dido maculis trementis interfusa genas, <hi rend="ital">stained with spots</hi> (<hi rend="ital">of blood</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:644" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 644</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Styx coërcet (animas),</quote> <trans><tr>interposed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 439</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interfusa nitentes Vites aequora Cycladas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:14:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 14, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oceanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 68, 68, § 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <trans><tr>intervening</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:677" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 677</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opacitas,</quote> <trans><tr>intervening</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 25, § 93</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interfuro: <entryFree id="n24269" type="main" key="interfu^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-fŭro</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rage between</hi> or <hi rend="ital">through</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:395" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 395</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interfusio: <entryFree id="n24270" type="main" key="interfu_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interfūsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>interfundo</etym>, <sense id="n24270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flowing between</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">maris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 3, 25</bibl></cit>. <cb n="INTE" /></sense></entryFree>
interfusus: <entryFree id="n24271" type="main" key="interfu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interfūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. interfun. do <sense id="n24271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
interfuturus: <entryFree id="n24272" type="main" key="interfu^tu_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interfŭtūrus</orth>, v. intersum.</entryFree>
intergannitus: <entryFree id="n24273" type="main" key="interganni_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intergannītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, see the foll. art.</entryFree>
intergarritus: <entryFree id="n24274" type="main" key="intergarri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intergarrītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from the obsolete intergarrio [inter-garrio], <sense id="n24274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">prated</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chattered between</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dein pauculis verbis intergarritis (al. intergannitis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 284, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intergeries: <entryFree id="n24275" type="gloss" key="interge^ri^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-gĕrĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. gero</etym>, <sense id="n24275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a partition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">party-wall</hi>: intergeries, paries, <foreign lang="greek">toi=xos o( du/o kth/seis diori/zwn,</foreign> i. e. murus duas possessiones separans, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
intergerinus: <entryFree id="n24276" type="main" key="interge^ri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intergĕrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. intergerivus.</entryFree>
intergerium: <entryFree id="n24277" type="spur" key="interge^ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intergĕrĭum</orth>, false read. for intergerivi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 26, § 82</bibl>.</entryFree>
intergerivus: <entryFree id="n24278" type="main" key="interge^ri_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intergĕrīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>intergeries</etym>, <sense id="n24278.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is placed between; subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tergĕrīvus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. paries), <hi rend="ital">a partition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">party-wall</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 26, § 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:173" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 14, 49, § 173</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the walls of wax in a beehive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 10, 10, § 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intergero: <entryFree id="n24279" type="main" key="interge^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-gĕro</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to place between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insert</hi> walls: intergerivi parietes dicuntur, qui inter confines struuntur, et quasi intergeruntur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=110:21" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 110, 21</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
intergressus: <entryFree id="n24280" type="main" key="intergressus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intergressus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (only in <sense id="n24280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>from the obs. intergredior</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a coming between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intervention</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">disputationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Octav. 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interhio: <entryFree id="n24281" type="main" key="inte^rhi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕr-hĭo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be open between</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interibi: <entryFree id="n24282" type="main" key="inte^ri^bi^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕr-ĭbĭ</orth> (interibei, Sen. con. de Bac. C. 1 R. 196), <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n24282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the meantime</hi>, for interea, interim (ante- and post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 6, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 85</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 320, 29</bibl> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:7:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 7, 17</bibl>, the correct read. is interim).</sense></entryFree>
interibilis: <entryFree id="n24283" type="main" key="inte^ri^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕrĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>intereo</etym>, <sense id="n24283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perishable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mortal</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">nihil,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 65</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interim: <entryFree id="n24284" type="main" key="inte^rim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕrim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>inter and old <case>acc.</case> of is</etym>. <sense id="n24284.0" n="I" level="1"> I.q. interea, <hi rend="ital">meanwhile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the meantime</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibo intro: tu hic ante aedes interim speculare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interim dum ante ostium sto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc interim spatio conclave illud concidisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo fugit interim dolor ille?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:6" default="NO">1, 12, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24284.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">For a time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for a while</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut uno interim contenti simus exemplo C. Gracchi,</quote> <trans><tr>for the moment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interim admonere illud satis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:5" default="NO">3, 8, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24284.2" n="C" level="2"> (Cf. interea.) <hi rend="ital">However</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nevertheless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interim velim mihi ignescas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod alias vitiosum, interim alias rectum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:2 al" default="NO">2, 12, 2 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n24284.3" n="II" level="1"> I. q. nonnumquam, <hi rend="ital">sometimes</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Latinis quidem semper, sed etiam Graecis interim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">opp. semper, Sen. de Ira, 2, 21, 8: laturi sententiam indocti saepius atque interim rustici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:51" default="NO">11, 3, 51</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with nonnumquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interim ... interim,</quote> <trans><tr>sometimes ... sometimes</tr>, <tr>at one time ... at another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:59" default="NO">6, 3, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:100" default="NO">9, 2, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">interim ... mox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 41</bibl></cit> Dräger.</sense></entryFree>
interimo: <entryFree id="n24285" type="main" key="inte^ri^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕr-ĭmo</orth> (better than <orth extent="full" lang="la">interĕmo</orth>, Bramb. s. v., but v. Munro, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:Introd. p. 33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> Introd. p. 33</bibl>), ēmi, emptum, or <itype>emtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>emo</etym>, <sense id="n24285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take out of the midst</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">do away with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abolish; to destroy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kill</hi> (syn.: interficio, perimo; class.). </sense><sense id="n24285.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Abantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interimendorum sacrorum causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui Argum dicitur interemisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:22:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 22, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 288</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quae interimant, innumerabilia sint, etiam ea quae conservent, infinita esse debere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:19:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 19, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hasdrubale interempto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 72</bibl></cit>: qui ferro sunt interempti. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 5</bibl>.—So with <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to kill one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commit suicide</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucretia se ipsa interemit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 20, 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24285.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to kill</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to distress intolerably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illaec interemit me modo hic oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me quidem, judices, exanimant et interimunt hae voces Milonis,</quote> <trans><tr>distress me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interior: <entryFree id="n24286" type="main" key="inte^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕrĭor</orth>, <itype>ĭus</itype>, <sense id="n24286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> ōris [<hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> from inter, whence also <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> intimus], <hi rend="ital">inner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interior; nearer</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n24286.1" n="I.
