A." level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">in interiore aedium parte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 10</bibl></cit>: spatium,<pb n="981" /> <cb n="INTE" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:670" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 670</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">secessit in partem interiorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 8</bibl></cit>: in interiore parte ut maneam solus cum sola, i.e. <hi rend="ital">within</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the women</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s apartment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">interior domus,</quote> <trans><tr>the inner part of the house</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:637" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 637</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">epistola,</quote> <trans><tr>the body of the letter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erit aliquid interius (mente),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motu cietur interiore et suo (opp. quod pulsu agitatur externo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:23:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 23, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nationes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>living farther in the interior</tr>, <tr>farther inland</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the life and soul</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 66</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24286.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕrĭōres</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">they who live farther inland</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Angrivarii multos redemptos ab interioribus reddidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 24</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24286.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕrĭōra</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the inner parts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">places</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:39:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 39, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,041:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jon. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deserti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Exod. 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24286.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Esp. of the body, <hi rend="ital">intestines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bowels</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interiorum morbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1 praef.</bibl></cit> § 68; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 39, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24286.5" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the feelings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">character</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interiora ejus plena sunt dolo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sir. 19, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24286.6" n="B" level="2"> Esp., in the race-course, <hi rend="ital">nearer the goal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the left;</hi> for they drove from right to left: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc stringam metas interiore rotā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:426" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 426</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gyrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:695" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 695</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et medius . . . ibat, et interior, si comes unus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:68" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 68</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24286.7" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n24286.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Nearer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">toto corpore interior periculo vulneris factus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>as he was too near him to be in danger of a wound from him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ictibus,</quote> <trans><tr>within the line of fire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torus,</quote> <trans><tr>the side nearest the wall</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 14, 32</bibl></cit>: nota Falerni, <hi rend="ital">from the inmost part of the cellar</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the oldest</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponda regiae lecticae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24286.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">More hidden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secret</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">unknown</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed haec quoque in promptu fuerint: nunc interiora videamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interiores et reconditae litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:16:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 16, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 2</bibl></cit>: haec interiora, <hi rend="ital">the personal worth</hi>, opp. illa externa, <hi rend="ital">public deeds</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 2, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24286.10" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Deeper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more intimate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nearer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">societas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitia interior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potentia,</quote> <trans><tr>greater</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:339" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 339</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <trans><tr>more profound</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 33, 2</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Neutr. plur.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in interiora regni se recepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 39</bibl></cit>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕrĭ-us</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">in the inner part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the inside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">within</hi>, = intra (freq. only since the Aug. per.): ne fluat oratio, ne vagetur, ne insistat interius, ne excurrat longius, i. e. <hi rend="ital">be too short</hi> or <hi rend="ital">brief</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:49:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 49, 190</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo sinu duo maria: Ionium in prima parte, interius Hadriaticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 26, 29, § 150</bibl></cit>; cf. Mela, 1, 6, 2; 1, 19, 1; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 1, 12: rapiat sitiens Venerem interiusque recondat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 137</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 306</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24286.11" n="B" level="2"> Esp. <hi rend="ital">farther inland</hi>, <hi rend="ital">farther from the sea</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">penetrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:120:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 120, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1:12" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 19, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 26, 29, § 150</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24286.12" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> of mental operations, <hi rend="ital">more inwardly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">deeply</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne insistat interius (oratio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:49:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 49, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">attendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:15" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interitio: <entryFree id="n24287" type="main" key="inte^ri^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕrĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>intereo</etym>, for interitus, <sense id="n24287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">destruction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aratorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:54:section=125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 54, § 125</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interitus: <entryFree id="n24288" type="main" key="inte^ri^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕrĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from intereo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24289" type="main" key="inte^ri^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕrĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>intereo</etym>, <sense id="n24289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">destruction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annihilation</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">interitus est quasi discessus et secretio, ac diremptio earum rerum, quae junctione aliqua tenebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium rerum interitus atque obitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:16:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pravitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immaturus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuum ingemuisse interitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interius: <entryFree id="n24290" type="main" key="inte^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕrĭus</orth>. <sense id="n24290.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj. comp.</hi>, from interior. —</sense><sense id="n24290.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, v. interior <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
interjaceo: <entryFree id="n24291" type="main" key="interja^ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-jăcĕo</orth>, <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n24291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lie between;</hi> constr. with <case>dat.</case>, <case>acc.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">inter</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">interjacebat campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 41</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">campus interjacens Tiberi ac moenibus Romanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 30</bibl></cit>: via interjacente, Plin. et Trag. Ep. 33, 1.— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed his ipsis media interjacent multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 18</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio, quae duas Syrtes interjacet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 4, § 27</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">inter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interjacet haec inter eam et Rhodum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 60</bibl></cit>. <cb n="INTE" /></sense></entryFree>
interjacio: <entryFree id="n24292" type="main" key="interja^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-jăcĭo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-jĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>jēci, jectum</itype> (in tmesi: <sense id="n24292.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">inter enim jecta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:859" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 859</bibl></cit>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>jacio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to throw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cast between; to set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">put between; to join</hi> or <hi rend="ital">add to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to intermix</hi> (class., most freq. in the <hi rend="ital">part. pass.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">legionarias cohortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleraque sermone Latino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id interjecit inter individuum, atque id, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces ct minas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 81</bibl></cit>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">interjectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, <hi rend="ital">thrown</hi> or <hi rend="ital">placed between; interposed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interspersed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intervening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intermingled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intermediate;</hi> constr. with <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">inter.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24292.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nasus oculis interjectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24292.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interjecti inter philosophos, et eos qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 26, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aer inter mare et caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter has personas me interjectum amici moleste ferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 7, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24292.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi longo intervallo interjecto,</quote> <trans><tr>as it were a great way off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anno interjecto,</quote> <trans><tr>after a year</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucis interjectis diebus,</quote> <trans><tr>after a few days</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24292.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With Gr. <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: erat interjecta comas, <hi rend="ital">with loose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishevelled hair</hi>, Claud. Epith. Pall. et Celer. 28 dub.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-terjecta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">places lying between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interjacent places</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interjecta inter Romam et Arpos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interjectio: <entryFree id="n24293" type="main" key="interjecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interjectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>interjacio</etym>, <sense id="n24293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a throwing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">placing between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insertion.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24293.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 6, 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24293.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n24293.3" n="A" level="2"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">an interjection</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24293.4" n="B" level="2"> In rhet., <hi rend="ital">a parenthesis,</hi> an interruption of the principal idea by the insertion of another: <cit><quote lang="la">interjectio qua et oratores et historici frequentes utuntur, ut medio sermone aliquem inserant sensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interjective: <entryFree id="n24294" type="main" key="interjecti_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interjectīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. interjectivus <sense id="n24294.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
interjectivus: <entryFree id="n24295" type="main" key="interjecti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interjectīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>interjacio</etym>, <sense id="n24295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">placed between</hi> (post-class.): rigor, Simplic. de Re Agrar. p. 78.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-terjectīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">in the manner of an interjection</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
interjectura: <entryFree id="n24296" type="main" key="interjectu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interjectūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an insertion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:de Colon. p. 135" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> de Colon. p. 135</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interjectus: <entryFree id="n24297" type="main" key="interjectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interjectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. interjacio <sense id="n24297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24298" type="main" key="interjectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interjectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>interjacio</etym>, <sense id="n24298.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a throwing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">placing between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interposition; a coming between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intervention</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n24298.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides temerario interjectu ponere, App. de Deo, Soc. Prol. p. 365, 15: luna interpositu interjectuque terrae repente deficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:40:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 40, 103</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24298.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an interval</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">petito paucorum dierum interjectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 67</bibl></cit>.—Esp. <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>: interjectu, <hi rend="ital">after an interval</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with an interval</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctis,</quote> <trans><tr>after a night</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucorum dierum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvi temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 48:15" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 48, 15</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">interjectibus capere fructum,</quote> <trans><tr>at various times</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:21:61" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 21, 61</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interjicio: <entryFree id="n24299" type="main" key="interji^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interjĭcĭo</orth>, v. interjacio.</entryFree>
interjunctus: <entryFree id="n24300" type="main" key="interjunctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interjunctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from interjungo.</entryFree>
interjungo: <entryFree id="n24301" type="main" key="interjungo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-jungo</orth>, <itype>nxi, nctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n24301.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To join together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">join</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextrae interjunctae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:30:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 30, 6</bibl></cit> (cf. interaptus): <cit><quote lang="la">interjunctus (equus) equis,</quote> <trans><tr>harnessed among</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:308" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 308</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24301.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To unyoke.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24301.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lassos equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:67:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 67, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et quasi interjungo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 83:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 83, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. B. infra.—</sense><sense id="n24301.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to rest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medio die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 17:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 17, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:6:16" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 6, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interlabor: <entryFree id="n24302" type="main" key="interla_bor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-lābor</orth>, <itype>lapsus sum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n24302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glide</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">flow between</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">per has stellis interlabentibus umbras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:649" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 649</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(in tmesi), inter enim labentur aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 349</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:18" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 18</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvius lucos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 8, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interlateo: <entryFree id="n24303" type="main" key="interla^te^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-lătĕo</orth>, <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lurk</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lie hid between</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:16:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 16, 4</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
interlatrans: <entryFree id="n24304" type="hapax" key="interla^trans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-lătrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [interlatro], <sense id="n24304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">barking between</hi> (eccl. Lat.), trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">peccata inter nos et Deum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
interlectio: <entryFree id="n24305" type="main" key="interlecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-lectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. lego</etym>, <sense id="n24305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reading between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a reading together</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">scripturarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Uxor. 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interlego: <entryFree id="n24306" type="main" key="interle^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-lĕgo</orth>, <itype>lēgi, lectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cull</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pluck off here and there</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and postclass.):<cb n="INTE" />  (in tmesi) uncis Carpendae manibus frondes, interque legendae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 366</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 25, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Jun. 5, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interlido: <entryFree id="n24307" type="main" key="interli_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-līdo</orth>, <itype>līsi, līsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>laedo</etym>. <sense id="n24307.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To thrust out of the midst</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to strike out</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">litteris interlisis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24307.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To strike against</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 10, 261</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interligo: <entryFree id="n24308" type="main" key="interli^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-lĭgo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. ligo</etym>, <sense id="n24308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bind together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterno maculas ostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:571" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 571</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(alga) insanas interligat undas,</quote> <trans><tr>restrains</tr>, <tr>hinders</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Rutil.</author> 1, 539</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interlino: <entryFree id="n24309" type="main" key="interli^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-lĭno</orth>, <itype>lēvi, lĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to smear between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay at intervals.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24309.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">caementa luto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 11, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">murus bitumine interlitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caseum oleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 34, § 132</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24309.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to falsify by striking out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">erasing</hi> (syn. interpolo): <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:44:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 44, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulae quae se corruptas atque interlitas esse clamant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:42:section=104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 42, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae lacrimis interlitae,</quote> <trans><tr>blotted</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 41 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
interlisus: <entryFree id="n24310" type="main" key="interli_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interlīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from interlido.</entryFree>
interlitus: <entryFree id="n24311" type="main" key="interli^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interlĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from interlino.</entryFree>
interloco: <entryFree id="n24312" type="hapax" key="interlo^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-lŏco</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24312.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to place between</hi>, Mela, 2, 1.</sense></entryFree>
interlocutio: <entryFree id="n24313" type="main" key="interlo^cu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interlŏcūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>interloquor</etym>, <sense id="n24313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a speaking between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interlocution.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24313.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">brevi interlocutione patroni refutandus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 26</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 17</bibl>, — </sense><sense id="n24313.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">an interlocutory sen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">severā interlocutione comminatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:15:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 15, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:1:11" default="NO">44, 1, 11</bibl>; Cod. Th. 11, 36, 1.</sense></entryFree>
interloquor: <entryFree id="n24314" type="main" key="interlo^quor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-lŏquor</orth>, <itype>lŏcūtus or lŏquūtus, 3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n24314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to speak between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interrupt in speaking.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24314.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">siccine mihi interloquere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 13</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse raro et breviter interlocutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 6, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24314.2" n="II" level="1"> In law, <hi rend="ital">to pronounce an interlocutory sentence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si judex ita interlocutus sit, Vim fecisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:32 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 32 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
interlucatio: <entryFree id="n24315" type="main" key="interlu_ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interlūcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>interluco</etym>, <sense id="n24315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lopping off of useless branches</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a thinning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pruning</hi> (Plinian), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 27, 45, § 257</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interluceo: <entryFree id="n24316" type="main" key="interlu_ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-lūcĕo</orth>, <itype>luxi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shine</hi> or <hi rend="ital">glitter forth</hi> at intervals (class.). </sense><sense id="n24316.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">duos soles visos, et noctu interluxisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia terrena quaedam animalia plerumque interlucent (in amber),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:45:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 45, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 20, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24316.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24316.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be manifest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plainly visible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci interlucent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 19, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus inter gradus dignitatis et fortunae aliquid interlucet,</quote> <trans><tr>by which the degrees of dignity and fortune are distinguished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:42:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 42, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24316.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be capable of being seen through</hi> (thin of substance or few in number), <hi rend="ital">to be transparent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interlucet corona (militum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:508" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 508</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:3:16" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 3, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interlucesco: <entryFree id="n24317" type="gloss" key="interlu_cesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-lūcesco</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <sense id="n24317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shine through</hi>: interlucesco, <foreign lang="greek">diafai/nomai,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
interluco: <entryFree id="n24318" type="main" key="interlu_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-lūco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>lux</etym>, <sense id="n24318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to let the light through</hi> a tree by clearing it of its useless branches; <hi rend="ital">to lop</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thin</hi> a tree (Plinian): <cit><quote lang="la">interlucata densitate ramorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 12, 19, § 94</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interludo: <entryFree id="n24319" type="main" key="interlu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-lūdo</orth>, <itype>lūsi, lūsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to play between</hi> or <hi rend="ital">together</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 10, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">interludamus epistolis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 47, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interlunis: <entryFree id="n24320" type="main" key="interlu_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-lūnis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>luna</etym>, <sense id="n24320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">at new moon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interlunar</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 6, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interlunium: <entryFree id="n24321" type="main" key="interlu_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interlūnĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>interlunis</etym>, <sense id="n24321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the new moon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">time of new moon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interlunary interval</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 32, 75, § 324</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:38" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 5, 4, § 38</bibl>. —In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 25, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interluo: <entryFree id="n24322" type="main" key="interlu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-lŭo</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n24322.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To wash while doing any thing</hi>: manus (<hi rend="ital">between the acts of a sacrifice</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 132</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24322.1" n="II" level="1"> Of rivers, <hi rend="ital">to wash under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flow between</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontus ... arva et urbes Litore diductas angusto interluit aestu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 419</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quosque secans infaustum interluit Allia nomen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 717</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxaque interluens unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum interluit fretum? (al. interfluit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod Capreas et Surrentum interluit fretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Nereus) abscissos interluit aequore montes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 143</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 70</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs interluitur Euphrate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 56, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interluvies: <entryFree id="n24323" type="main" key="interlu^vi^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interlŭvĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>interluo</etym>, <sense id="n24323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">water that flows between</hi> two places, <hi rend="ital">a strait</hi> <pb n="982" /> <cb n="INTE" /> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">angusta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 22, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angusta fluminis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intermaneo: <entryFree id="n24324" type="main" key="interma^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-mănĕo</orth>, <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to remain between</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">mediis agris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intermedius: <entryFree id="n24325" type="main" key="interme^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-mĕdĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intermediate</hi> (ante - class. and late Lat), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 26, 637</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intermenstruum: <entryFree id="n24326" type="main" key="intermenstru^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intermenstrŭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, see the foll. art.</entryFree>
intermenstruus: <entryFree id="n24327" type="main" key="intermenstru^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-menstrŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24327.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">between two months</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunā intermenstruā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>at the time of new moon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 32, 75, § 322</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">intermenstrŭum</orth>, i. <gen>n.</gen> (sc. tempus), <hi rend="ital">the new moon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">time of new moon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:37:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 37, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:16:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 16, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempore intermenstrui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 3, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intermeo: <entryFree id="n24328" type="main" key="interme^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-mĕo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pass through the midst of;</hi> with <case>acc.</case> (Plin. and late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Pergamum intermeat Selinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 33, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paludem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 11, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe,</quote> <trans><tr>to visit often</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 26, 6, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intermestris: <entryFree id="n24329" type="main" key="intermestris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-mestris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mensis</etym>, <sense id="n24329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">between two months</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a mensibus intermestris dictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:2:section=10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 2, § 10</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">luna,</quote> <trans><tr>the new moon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:R. R. 37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> R. R. 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 39, 75, § 194</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intermetium: <entryFree id="n24330" type="gloss" key="interme_ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-mētĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>meta</etym>, <sense id="n24330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the space between the goals</hi>: intermetium, <foreign lang="greek">to\ metacu\ tw=n kampth/rwn,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
intermico: <entryFree id="n24331" type="main" key="intermi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-mĭco</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n24331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to glitter among</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gleam forth</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">squamis intermicat aurum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 183</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenebras nimbosque intermicat ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:662" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 662</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:252" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 252</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interminabilis: <entryFree id="n24332" type="main" key="intermi^na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intermĭnābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-terminalis</etym>, <sense id="n24332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">endless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interminable</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurgium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interminatio: <entryFree id="n24333" type="main" key="intermi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intermĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>interminor</etym>, <sense id="n24333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a threatening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">menacing</hi> (post-class.): judicii, Cod. Th. 10, 20, 18; 16, 5, 18 al.</sense></entryFree>
interminatus: <entryFree id="n24334" type="main" key="intermi^na_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-termĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unbounded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endless</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">immensa et interminata magnitudo regionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeculorum cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Res Gest. Alex. 1:31:22" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Res Gest. Alex. 1, 31, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24334.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditas imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:33:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 33, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petendi licentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 4, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n24335" type="main" key="intermi^na_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intermĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from interminor.</entryFree>
interminis: <entryFree id="n24336" type="main" key="intermi^nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intermĭnis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-terminus</etym>, <sense id="n24336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">boundless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endless</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Res Gest. Alex. M. 1:30" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Res Gest. Alex. M. 1, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intermino: <entryFree id="n24337" type="spur" key="intermi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-mĭno</orth>, a false read. for in terrast, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 42</bibl>; v. Ritschl ad h. l.</entryFree>
interminor: <entryFree id="n24338" type="main" key="intermi^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-mĭnor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n24338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to threaten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">menace; to forbid with threats</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">mihi tibique interminatus est, nos futuros, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istuceine tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minor, interminorque, ne quis, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 16</bibl>.?*! <orth extent="full" lang="la">intermĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um; in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> sense: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus ( = interdictus, vetitus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:39" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 39</bibl></cit>: poena, <hi rend="ital">threatened</hi>, Cod. Th. 16, 5, 60.</sense></entryFree>
interminus: <entryFree id="n24339" type="main" key="intermi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-termĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">boundless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endless</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">oceanus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">felicitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 16, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapsus stellarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mund. p. 57, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intermisceo: <entryFree id="n24340" type="main" key="intermisce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-miscĕo</orth>, <itype>scui, xtum, or stum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to mix among</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intermix.</hi>—With <case>dat.</case> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">tibi undam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:57" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbam indignorum dignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 56</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">intermixti hostibus cognoscunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classe captiva intermixtis mulieribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:8:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 8, 3</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbabant equos pedites intermixti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 207" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 207</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intermissio: <entryFree id="n24341" type="main" key="intermissi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intermissĭo</orth> <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>intermitto</etym>, <sense id="n24341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breaking off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intermission</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interruption; a neglecting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ceasing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discontinuance</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">forensis operae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:68:142" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 68, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine ulla intermissione,</quote> <trans><tr>without any intermission</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:41:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 41, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a qua (actione) saepe fit intermissio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per intermissiones has intervallaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">febris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistularum,</quote> <trans><tr>interruption of a correspondence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intermissionem officii facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: si furiosus habet intermissionem,<cb n="INTE" />  <hi rend="ital">a lucid interval</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:1:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 1, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <trans><tr>formed in short clauses</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intermissus: <entryFree id="n24342" type="main" key="intermissus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intermissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from intermitto; q. v. <sense id="n24342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24343" type="hapax" key="intermissus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intermissus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>intermitto</etym>, for intermissio, <sense id="n24343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an intermission</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interruption</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">garrulus sine intermissu cantus,</quote> <trans><tr>incessant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 43, § 81</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intermitto: <entryFree id="n24344" type="main" key="intermitto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-mitto</orth>, <itype>mīsi, missum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n24344.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24344.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To leave off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intermit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">omit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neglect;</hi> constr. with <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">aliquid ab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24344.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admirationem rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:20:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 20, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officia militaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:1:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 25, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curam rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (otium) quidem paulisper intermisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 31, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qua erat nostrum opus intermissum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24344.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquid ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut reliquum tempus a labore intermitteretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 32, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus ab opere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 24, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 17, 1</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n24344.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla pars nocturni temporis ad laborem intermittitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 40, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 11, 6</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tu mihi litteras mittere intermisisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">non intermittit suo tempore caelum mitescere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulere rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 12, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsides dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 31</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24344.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To let pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffer to elapse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus, quin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum diem, quin veniat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 16, 1</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24344.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24344.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To leave off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallos gallinaceos sic assidue canere coepisse, ut nihil intermitterent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:34:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 34, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves intermittentes bibunt,</quote> <trans><tr>drink by separate draughts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 46, 63, § 129</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24344.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To leave an interval</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium, qua flumen intermittit,</quote> <trans><tr>does not flow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 171</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">febris intermittit,</quote> <trans><tr>is intermittent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">febris intermittens,</quote> <trans><tr>an intermitting fever</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 13</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">intermissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> </sense><sense id="n24344.9" n="A" level="2"> Of a place, <hi rend="ital">not occupied by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free from</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">custodiis loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 36, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 35, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">planities intermissa collibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24344.10" n="2" level="3"> Of time or space, <hi rend="ital">permitted to elapse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intervening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">left between.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24344.11" n="(a)" level="5"> Of time: <cit><quote lang="la">brevi tempore intermisso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24344.12" n="(b)" level="5"> Of space: <cit><quote lang="la">intermissis circiter passibus quadringentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 73 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n24344.13" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Intermitted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neglected</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">omitted</hi> for a time, <hi rend="ital">respited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interrupted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:26:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 26, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetus remorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censura diu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 16</bibl></cit>: nono die, intermisso rure, ad mercatum venire, Rutil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16, 34</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n24344.14" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Not surrounded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unenclosed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars oppidi, quae intermissa a flumine et a paludibus: aditum angustum habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trabes intermissae spatiis,</quote> <trans><tr>separated</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba prisca et ab usu quotidiani sermonis jamdiu intermissa,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>given up</tr>, <tr>abandoned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 12, 10, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per intermissa moenia urbem intrārunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>where the wall was discontinued</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies, non multarum imaginum et intermissarum, sed unius longae et continuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:3:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24344.15" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Left out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">omitted</hi> (late Lat.): nonnulla, quae mihi intermissa videbantur, adjeci, Hier. praef. ad Chron. Euseb.</sense></entryFree>
intermixtus: <entryFree id="n24345" type="main" key="intermixtus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intermixtus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">intermistus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from intermisceo.</entryFree>
intermorior: <entryFree id="n24346" type="main" key="intermo^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-mŏrĭor</orth>, <itype>mortuus sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <sense id="n24346.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To die in secret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perish unobserved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to die off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall to decay</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 161, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">radices intermoriuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 18, 69, § 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:6:31" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 6, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 49</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24346.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24346.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To faint away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to swoon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex profluvio sanguinis intermorientes vino reficiendi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24346.3" n="B" level="2"> Of roads, <hi rend="ital">to come to an end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stop</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars (viarum) sine ullo exitu intermoriuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:7:3:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 7, 3, § 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24346.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be neglected</hi>: nullum officium tuum apud me intermoriturum existimas, Bith. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 16</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">intermortŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">dead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lifeless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerless.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24346.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ipsa contione intermortuus haud multo post exspiravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:53:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 53, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diu prope intermortuus jacuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 42</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24346.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: gemmae jactatae in ignem, velut intermortuae, exstinguuntur, <cb n="INTE" /> <hi rend="ital">lose their lustre</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 27, § 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores boni plerique omnes jam sunt intermortui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catilinae reliquiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoria generis sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 7, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
intermortuus: <entryFree id="n24347" type="main" key="intermortu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intermortŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. intermorior, <sense id="n24347.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
intermoveo: <entryFree id="n24348" type="main" key="intermo^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-mŏvĕo</orth>, <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to move</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pass between</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">alios sulcos stilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 8:69" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 8, 69</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intermundia: <entryFree id="n24349" type="main" key="intermundi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-mundĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number> [mundus], <sense id="n24349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">spaces between the worlds</hi>, in which, acc. to Epicurus, the gods reside, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:23:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 23, 75</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:17:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 17, 40</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:8:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 8, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intermunus: <entryFree id="n24350" type="main" key="intermu_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-mūnus</orth>, <itype>nĕris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n24350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gift for a time</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a loan</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ennod.</author> Dict. 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intermuralis: <entryFree id="n24351" type="main" key="intermu_ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-mūrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">between two walls</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:46:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 46, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intermutatus: <entryFree id="n24352" type="main" key="intermu_ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intermūtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>inter-muto</etym>, <sense id="n24352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">interchanged</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">intermutatis manibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Baptism. 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
internas: <entryFree id="n24353" type="main" key="internas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">internas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype> <etym>inter, cf. supernas</etym>, <sense id="n24353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inner</hi>, Fronto ad Amic. 1, 17.</sense></entryFree>
internascor: <entryFree id="n24354" type="main" key="internascor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-nascor</orth>, <itype>nātus, 3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n24354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to grow between</hi> or <hi rend="ital">among</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">internascentes herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 16, 43, § 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgulta internata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">internatum corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 27, 42, § 251</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
internatidus: <entryFree id="n24355" type="main" key="interna^ti^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-nătĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>internates</etym>, <sense id="n24355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">situated between the nates</hi>, Fronto ad Amic. 1, 16.</sense></entryFree>
internatus: <entryFree id="n24356" type="main" key="interna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">internātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from internascor.</entryFree>
interne: <entryFree id="n24357" type="main" key="interne^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">internĕ</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. internus, <sense id="n24357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
internecialis: <entryFree id="n24358" type="spur" key="interne^ci^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">internĕcĭālis</orth>, a false read. for perniciales, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 23</bibl>.</entryFree>
internecida: <entryFree id="n24359" type="gloss" key="interne^ci_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">internĕcīda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>internecio</etym>, <sense id="n24359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who by false testimony deprives another of his life</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
internecies: <entryFree id="n24360" type="gloss" key="interne^ci^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">internĕcĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, for internecio, <sense id="n24360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slaughter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">death</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi>: internecies, mors, jactura, Gloss. Isid.</sense></entryFree>
internecine: <entryFree id="n24361" type="main" key="interne^ci_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">internĕcīnē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, see the foll. art.</entryFree>
internecinus: <entryFree id="n24362" type="main" key="interne^ci_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">internĕcīnus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">internĕcīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>internecio</etym>, <sense id="n24362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deadly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murderous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destructive</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:58:3" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 58, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">odia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 6</bibl></cit>: internecini actio, <hi rend="ital">for poisoning</hi>, Cod. Th. 9, 1, 14: internecini judicium, <hi rend="ital">of one who has committed perjury</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 5, 26</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">internĕcīnē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with utter destruction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta disperdere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 9, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
